7B3SSAwJ6MCeD4lt_Eh_gQ.text: Good food! Def expensive for breakfast food! But the quality is there. The chicken fried steak Taste like real steak, which was a nice surprise and good size portions.

7YdOUoYGR6zjtKquR2CPng.text: The service was great, our waiter had a great sense of humor and was sufficient at his job. We went on Wednesday so not to busy at all. The cup of bread was delecious! The most I had was just an omlet nothing fancy. It was slightly overpriced but overall a great new place for breakfast.

t1KWzI3k3qvJ0NWLmjn4gg.text: Oh my! This is my new go to weekend breakfast spot. Staff are all so friendly and I love that the servers wear pajamas for their uniform! So cute. I've noticed some reviews say that service is slow but I haven't noticed that at all. Indoor and outdoor seating. Lots of options on the menu. All of their juices are made fresh.I usually start with the green go juice. Portion sizes are big, at least for me. So far I've had veggie eggs benny, chilaquiles, veggie bagel sandwich (huge!) and good ole steak and eggs. Loved them all. Just writing this review has me craving the place.

XCJZ_nGbR11tTeqF8O9vaQ.text: I went to this place when they opened their original location in southern highlands. Good then, good now.They wear pajamas and serve a mean breakfast. The French Toast is excellent. My wife had the chilaquiles. They had a spicy rub,   not that saucey. French roast coffee, they brought out sand timers to distinguish how bold you wanted it. That's different. We sat down immediately but the place looked pretty full, food came out quickly. I woukd come back. Welcome to Hendo!

vmdlPkTbrJqjZxuT_KUmZw.text: Just had our first experience here and we were very favorably impressed with the food and the service. The hostess and cashier were super nice and seemed genuinely happy that we were there on a busy Sunday morning. Our waitress, Maria, did a great job explaining the menu and providing attentive service. Our food came out hot and delicious. I tried pancakes and eggs and was really surprised how delicious the food was. It was a conservative first try but I feel if they get that right other options are worth checking out next time. My wife really enjoyed the salmon and Lox omelet. I highly recommend this spot for a nice breakfast experience.

qX3C68teA1kkaHdq3h9LTA.text: Rise and Shine is easy to get Into, adorable umbrella decor and Maria was a very attentive server. They serve more than two slices of bacon and it is delicious!

s3tFw1ZB3tZgHC-jQE9Xfw.text: The breakfasts here are very very good. The portions are very large. The steak was overdone a bit but had a great flavor.

IPC4VHuYlAx_51PYKOwNTA.text: This was my first time at this place and I have to give it five huge stars! I ordered pickup and stopped in the place is really cute and the people are really friendly. Even the pickup order after driving home was still the bomb! Fresh, plenty of food and so flavorful. Me and the hubs got the three little pigs bagel and the steak chilaquiles...they both were really good! Definitely the new breakfast spot for us!!!!

_Eda5rvc5hoDabMaLhtO3w.text: So happy that we have a breakfast place walking distance from home!  I have to say that I was a bit taken aback by the prices.  Almost $20 for a simple omelette meal, coffee and 20% tip.  However,  the omelette was tasty as well as the hash browns.   I ordered the cup of bread and my server noticed that it looked a bit overcooked.   She had me try it and then brought me a much better one after agreeing it was not good.  Very attentive service and quick to get my meal.

75I-fp9K1uF8AWOG9bcxCg.text: This place embodies the phrase, "Rise and Shine." Waiters are in pajamas, merchandise have breakfast puns on them, and decor has floral print all over. I actually enjoyed it all.   I ordered the Rise & Shine Burrito, which was amazing. I love large portions of food and this burrito satisfied that. It came covered in Ranchero and Green sauce (half and half). The burrito came with refried beans, which I asked to substitute for something else. For whatever reason the waitress said that wasn't possible, so I just went along with the beans. Ultimately, the refried beans were actually really good too! I also ordered a coffee, and the staff made sure that the coffee cup never became empty.   The one thing that bothered me was that the menu had A LOT going on, but that's just me being picky.

OTBLJRkytxCC3ImCbWFx8g.text: The cinnamon crunch French toast was amazing.  My wife had lox and Salmon omelet (keto friendly) was fantastic. If your in the area it's a must try.

lM_1nDmZWVD_JWjGkRYWUQ.text: Great food and amazing service!  Maria is a wonderful server, and the food is excellent every time we eat here!  My favorite place to eat breakfast in the Valley!

kQftAyV3sZPs0jd_d-fCBA.text: We just ate at Rise and Shine for the first time. We plan to make it a regular stop. All 7 of us loved the food. The pancakes were incredible. Same with the steak omelette. Our server, Maria was friendly and helpful.

7Kbz2QTNkIXW8NLf2l8ZQg.text: Totally unaccommodating for a large party of 8. They wouldn't take our name even though we were on our way with our hungry kids, and they require a $50 deposit 2 days in advance. So we took our business elsewhere, to a nearby breakfast place that happily took our name down as a call-ahead. They just lost our business, and not just this one time but as repeat patrons. We eat out every Sunday and spend an average of $50-75 each time. Bad business move on their part.

_Tvpb6ciTYruM-0Fi1PYtA.text: It is awesome to have a Rise and Shine in Henderson, NV, excellent steak and eggs and the pot of bread is delicious. They have fresh squeezed juices and fresh brewed hot coffee.

Kq_6EtDf0o8MhjoHbKUO_A.text: My first time here.  The service was great from Maria.  I had their new breakfast burrito..the green chili and pork carnita.  Very tasty...although had to much pork and not enough eggs.  Spoke to Maria about it and she let the kitchen know, so they can fix it in the future..

6RAuQS41AfJ0QgnZyjGamw.text: Delicious food and good service! Definitely should try it out, won't regret. The service is fast. The portion of the meal is huge. Loved it here.

o0l_4UvI-SQP1pUuA8Q87w.text: Maria was a bomb waitress!! She should be running the show! She is a show stoppa and a mimosa droppa! I love Maria G! I came all the way from Ohio to see her! Bomb.com and the food is always amazing!!! Love this place!!!! 10 stars!!!

TQ9Zi-hZ_EPNgYaJrARWZA.text: The first time I had the food it was brought home to me by my husband and it was amazing. The second time we went in and ate. Let me start by saying the environment and decor is amazing. It's so cheerful and bright. I could stay there all day and be in a great mood. And yet again the food was amazing. The service was great and our waitress was so sweet. Our friends steak was over cooked the last time we got food from here so he was hesitant to come back. The waitress was so sweet about it when we told her and kept telling us if anything is ever wrong please tell us we will fix it don't worry. I would highly recommend this place. I can't wait to have family or friends visiting and bring them here.

VRJ8sG3LgIDkHdiom21CZA.text: Bagel with cream cheese cucumber and tomato cost me 7.50. Ridiculous pricing. Only reason it gets two stars as oppose to 1 is due to the fact the food was okay

8KXOJA0er9SwLjqL3SP5_Q.text: I thought the food was pretty good, a little over priced but nothing wild. It may have been an off day but the service was pretty bad. I felt like I had upset my waitress or something when we first got there. I won't be going back but I won't say it's not worth a try.

IbuvK04Mi8Mk1Yae4kQE4g.text: My girlfriend and I come here for our breakfast dates on the regular. The food, atmosphere, and service is great! Our server today was Maria, excellent service and once again the food was awesome! Thanks Rise and Shine!

cJE5-b_08bWyaHfsFvgB8g.text: The begining of my adventure:  As I live near this location I always said, " I want to try that place." Unfortunately I am not a morning person so for me to drag myself out from under my down comforter and at least make an attempt to not look like a swamp demon is though to say the least. But after fighting my desire to stay in bed I made my way to this place. I wish I had know the staff wore PJs as their work attire I would have stayed in mine, minus the eye boogers and snarled hair. I thought, hey this is kind of cool and fun. The decor reminded me of something that might come from a childs cartoon or dream after eating something from Alice in wonderland, with bright and vibrant umbrellas and giant paper butterflies floating about.   The menu and drink:  Ok, onto the food because that is what this place specializes in. The menu has in my opinion your usual breakfast staples. Nothing over the top like cherry jubilee bubble gum fizzy wizzy pop pop pancakes. One thing that did catch my eye was something called pot o' bread. After struggling to keep my eyes open, as I mentioned I am not a morning person, I settled on the corned beef hash and a side of pot o' bread and an apple juice. The OJ is fresh pressed, however the apple juice was nothing special just your overly sugared apple juice. At least there was nothing floating in it.  The Pot o' bread:   The pot o' bread came out before my meal. When I saw the bread I said to myself, " well isn't that just the cutest little loaf of bread." It comes out in a white porcelain cup just big enough for an infant, with the bread billowing out of the top, dusted with powdered sugar. On the side is a vat of maple cream cheese glaze. Ok, maybe not a vat but hey one can wish. If you decide to go with this choice be prepared to feel like you are eating a warm cinnamon cloud dipped in ooey gooey sweet goodness. I wish I could have ordered a case of these and taken them home with me. The pot o' bread that gets 5 stars.   The main feast:  Onto the corned beef hash. I have eaten a truck load of this stuff in my life time so I would say I am hash connoisseur. As our waiter brings it out I can see an angelic beam of light shinning down on my hash. Ok, not really but I was just hungry and couldn't wait to eat. He finally gets to our table after what seems like forever and gives me my hash. I am thinking its going to be a pile of chopped corned beef and hearty potatoes all fried to perfection with a soft yolked fried egg waiting to be split open and let that golden yolk flood the hash. Que the whoomp whoomp sound track...... Like a kid who was expecting the latest and greatest mom's and grandma's knocking each other out toy for Christmas only to tear off the paper and see the my mom waited to long and bought the knock off version from a man only known as I know a guy, in the back alley, I hung my head and I think a felt a single tear roll down my cheek. It turned out to be some sort of faint I left my barbie hairbrush out in the sun for 2 weeks after playing with outside after mom told me no lukewarmish semi fried what I think was beef and some hard potato remnants that came from the corner of the grill. It was topped off with a mangled orange slice and one very the chef feel asleep at the grill and tried to scrape the burnt pieces off the edges and hope no one notices egg.   The Service:   The service was not spectacular award winning tell Gordon Ramsey he needs to drop everything and come see this place but it also wasn't tell Gordon Ramsey he needs to come take care of business because it sucks either. It was just there. I give the place 3 glittery twinkling stars only because of the pot o' bread and the giant flouncy butterflies.

-PrXCjjCz-CNAayP6qVwQA.text: We came in on a Monday around 10am not too busy. The orange juice was good it was the sweetest fresh squeezed juice I've ever had. My husband had the fancy steak house omelette he said the seasoning was good on the steak, but it was fatty. I had the Veggie Benny not a fan. It had everything I love on it and yet it was terrible. I think the balsamic drizzle killed it for me and I love balsamic. The guacamole they slather on the bottom had gone passed its prime and was pretty flavorless. The best part of breakfast was the cup of bread. Yet for 47.00 with tip is quite a bit for a breakfast of this caliber. Probably will not be back it's a shame because it is pretty close to our house.

rLxJaYZfDd3chBbhjStf6g.text: This place is dope! Great service, great food, great people, great price! I recommend this to anyone who likes good price for good food.

LvpgXGAyU35RS77L858y5Q.text: This is my second time eating breakfast here at this restaurant.  My steak was cooked as ordered, the potatoes and coffee was yummy.  My happy to have this place in Henderson.  There's a lot of good breakfast establishments in this area but this place is quickly becoming my favorite, especially with the gracious servers dressed in pjs!

O30bNzI0Cg5Z9YFocBpg9Q.text: Stopped in today because I like the food and have always had a nice experience in the past. The food is good and most of the employees are friendly. I arrived at 1:30- they close at 3:00. There were at least 4 or 5 other tables also in use, including 1 that came after me. I understand you might be cleaning up areas not being used to get a jump on closing, but the person wiped down the booth I was sitting in. Took the condiments off my table and practically threw them back at me. She did not put them back in the condiment holder on the table. The waitress did when she returned to my table. The person cleaning seemed to be angry about something and was taking it out on the restaurant and by default the customers. Good food- good waitress, but one person can change the atmosphere of the place

ev6bQlMcgYeLrGTorYcRtQ.text: Had breakfast here this morning for the first time. Everything on the menu sounded delicious. I had the Texas cut French Toast, husband had Corned Beef Hash and we shared Biscuits & Gravy and also the Bread in a Cup as recommended by our waitress, Maria, who was very friendly and informative. We thoroughly enjoyed everything and can't wait to go again! Will probably try lunch next visit. The decor and atmosphere was very nice too.

DqIpA7OkULLuUFgBsI7E1w.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast spots. We were kindly waitressed by Maria whip provided exvellant service.  My favorite is the belgian waffle- crisp on the outside, soft within and served with a hot glass bottle of cinnamon maple syrup. My boyfriend had the avocado eggs benedict that he described as very avocado-y.  We'll definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Henderson, NV, United States

orib7J_aypYOP5Wwa1m_ug.text: A little pricey, but worth it. Wait staff is always cordial, food is always good, grass is always green. Low wait times, if any. Their green juice is the shit, it reminds me of Mexico timeshares, without any cartel beheadings. Load up the fam, drive here, eat food, get fat, be happy.

iajRx7FecQQFm2G4UxsbtQ.text: There's a reason there is a wait list. Food was great and the portions give you eats for later. Definitely check it out, wait staff get to wear pajamas.

Ea4QNHM3bAFOVWxzO-1k1w.text: This was my first time here with my lady. We were in our way to another hidden gem in Henderson for some breakfast and decided to stop here instead. Great place with amazing food. Our server, Mike, came over and greeted us after we sat down and offered his opinion on many items on the menu. His service is phenomenal. The French press coffee is a must! We had an amazing time and we will definitely be back. Thank you again Mike!

6s1qcPee2XD1O3ZVO22ieQ.text: The food and service here is awesome! This was our first time in and we were blown away by the portion size and how delicious the food was. Maria was a fantastic and super attentive server. We would definitely recommend it here and will absolutely come back.

qORRkMxZklPcLrv7xzgPaQ.text: Went here for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised and happy that there is another breakfast place near my house.  The decor is very friendly and colorful which I love.  They have upside down umbrellas hanging from the ceiling which is pretty unique and indicative of a street in England.  I ordered a lot so I could try a bit of everything:    I got the cup of bread which is essentially a cinnamon roll cooked in a coffee cup with cream cheese frosting to dip.  It was good but needed more cinnamon and I would've preferred a glaze to dip.  I got a side of biscuits and gravy which again was good but too pricey for what it was.  Also, my biscuit was hard as a rock, luckily they replaced it for free.  My main dish was the chilaquiles which was very tasty.  Chips, with ranchero sauce, cheese, refried beans, salsa, sour cream, two eggs, and avocado.    They have so many different types of dishes, many that are not seen elsewhere that I really want to try.  Guess I'll have to go back!

o1Yl9EAN3whsJK1YI0s0nw.text: This place was great as was the food and service! Our server, Maria, was super sweet and attentive especially because is injured currently so it was extra nice to see she cared!  We will be definitely be back

uUufa-0aBt8oSQM54YE2OA.text: Has pretty spinning flowers that make my kids eyes light up. The steak is divine. The staff is comfortable and efficient. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Henderson, NV, United States

1vugr_otz2arazcS5YhK5A.text: Great little breakfast place! Our server was Maria and she was great-fast and friendly! We ordered the cinnamon crunch French toast and the ultimate steak and eggs. They were both amazing! Will definitely be back soon!

7NNy92C4UOUjjCoYoXuISg.text: Comfortable place. Excellent service. Interesting decor. I had breakfast food.  Good.

u6kx1PYfws5pVMN6QdacCg.text: Food was great!!  Had their version of Loco Moco, rib-eye steak burger, spam and over medium eggs cooked just right! Server Maria was very nice and attentive as well.

vv1zB9Ryu3MIKzRm0bzPdw.text: Best food ever. 3 times to Vegas  in the last month. 3 times to rise and shine. Service was outstanding. Our waitress was awesome.  Only place to eat for breakfast.  Thanks again.  All the way from Huntington Beach

7gQ9tHah2BavNzgdfZId4Q.text: Great little spot , we live in the area so walked here , and best of all we could bring our Dog and eat on the outdoor patio with her . Good fresh juice and smoothie menu as well

rbI3Qa-Z5JlQcWa7KbyiIQ.text: I'm constantly trying to find a decent breakfast spot since I've moved here to Vegas from NYC. Today I Finally had the chance to try Rise & Shine out and i was pleasantly surprised to say the least. The Decor was bright and beautiful and the place looked clean. One of the 1st things that really stood out was the server's all dressed in their Pajamas, sooo adorable! As indecisive as I am, Sharon our waiter was extremely kind and helpful, she even made great menu suggestions. Their Chicken n Waffles were Amazing, Juicy lean chicken Breast and Not greasy at all, the Waffles were light n fresh! My husband enjoyed his French toast and Turkey kielbasa and their coffee was actually pretty good, not the cheap stuff thank God! ...the only constructive criticism I had was that their kids meals were way too tiny for the price, which didn't even include their drink. But the food overall was delicious and Sharon was an Excellent host, her infectious smile and attitude will definitely bring us back plus as a New Yorker I really want to try their bacon egg n cheese bagel lol Thanks Rise & Shine!

ugZF8YBkoxpeJGfHyr12yw.text: The food was mediocre at best I had the corn beef hash with eggs, my wife had the red velvet pancakes. The hash was soggy because the eggs were served on top. The velvet pancakes were too crisp not burnt but over done, and the white chocolate chips still were not melted and did not taste good with the red velvet pancakes

Mnvl12qJ3VhTatNdccmDbA.text: Have tried to order from UberEats twice and you guys rejected my order for reasons I am unaware of. If you don't deliver, why are you on the website??   Lost my business forever.  Sincerely,  A very hungry, upset patron.

B8DmGHLOuXwr_3kVxccvcg.text: We stumbled on this spot when we came into town from LA. It was the day before Thanksgiving, and oh man did we hit the jack pot! My other half needed a proper brekkie so we held out,  but had fed the kids just 30 min earlier since they couldn't wait.  Dane was our server and he walked us through the menu telling us his favorite things to eat. We got the carne asada chilaquiles (my go to happy place) and my other half got a stack of  buttermilk pancakes and Dane switched it up for us and got it with toasted pecans and bananas. (hubby's fave for brekkie)  Our kids got FOMO and even though they had a full meal 30 min before they also got a stack or pancakes and french toast (which they make with Texas toast) it was amazing and we topped it off with mimosas!  Dane was so personable and such a gracious host that we decided to come back again this morning! The kids ate red velvet pancakes, buttermilk pancakes and me and my other half had the chilaquiles (again), steak And eggs, and also cinnamon crunchy french toast. We got to say hi to our buddy Dane again and it was such a great stop over before we hit the road back to LA   Thanks Dane ! We will be back to eat here the next time we visit.

gMCnr_L_cNaeIOEINfnq0w.text: This place is awesome! There menu is full of options & the food is really good & love there smoothies & fresh squeezed orange juice. Our server Maria was amazing too. Everyone should definitely stop by and check this breakfast spot out

Kpw2mY2GRgbO6GoVxL1DwA.text: I normally don't eat breakfast and have never really cared for breakfast spots... But now I know it's because I haven't had good breakfast until now! I am so impressed with this place for not being afraid to actually season their food! Each bite was bursting with flavor! And not super greasy like a lot of breakfast places tend to be . The ribeye steak is as good as it looks in the pictures! Biscuits were good but the gravy is some of the best gravy I have ever had! And those hashbrowns, so flavorful! The Ambiance is casual but inviting with lots of natural light with lots of windows. I am so excited to go back and try more things on the menu! Thanks for making me a fan of breakfast!  Luckily I live just a few minutes away so I plan on coming often

eYZe_8GPLAxczT0QJTfWig.text: Found this wonderful place by accident. Sharron was awesome and the food was outstanding!!!! The cup o bread is a cup of heaven! The main entrees were well proportioned and delicious! My fam will be back next trip to Vegas.

HFmGFXrd_Ilb3htyeASGIg.text: Disgusting. I asked for medium rare steak and got it delivered and the steak and hash were burnt to the point where it's way past well done. So disappointed they would even think a human could eat this crap. Just because it's a delivery doesn't mean you make people garbage to go. So disgusted. 0 stars.

phsjsPBsH_flTzAKoHwihA.text: Very disappointed. Recommended and went to try it and my husband ordered the rib eye steak for 17.50 and it wasn't very good at all. The meat wasn't tasty and had pieces that he couldn't even chew. For the princes u pay I wouldn't recommend this restaurant.

FNFSlufz-RuxFpV_gK6G9w.text: This was our first time here and we absolutely enjoyed every bite!  Mikee was the best waiter and took excellent care of us. You must try the "Cup of Bread". It was amazing!!!

Bsqn-6GBzltoT5wI2l1kgQ.text: Great place for breakfast! Love the "bread in a cup" which is actually a cinnamon roll baked in cup with frosting on the side! TO DIE FOR! My favorite breakfast is the ham and eggs Benedict, what makes this special is the drizzle of balsamic on the hollandaise sauce, perfect poached eggs. Sliced ham instead of Canadian bacon! Awesome! My friend had other things and cleaned their plates! Will be back, Maria is the one who helped me decide on the bread in a cup and I'm so glad she did! Great service! Thanks Maria!

CuUGzFgzm6z659R1HU3Y7w.text: No complaints about service or attitude.  The place is stripped down diner decor, but neat and clean.  I ordered eggs Benedict and, as an almost after thought the server asked if I wanted Worcester sauce with it .  I said "yes" - big, big mistake.  It came with so much Worcester sauce that I could hardly see the eggs.  I'm sure that neither the server nor the cook has ever eaten Eggs Benedict plastered like this.  I tasted nothing but the sauce.  To those who don't eat Worcester sauce:  a little goes a long way.    Note to management: If you want to offer Worcester sauce, put a bottle on the table and let the customer help himself.  In short: good food (I suppose) ruined.

ttdzMkr1LSHkr10k_j1kCA.text: Not the best place. Nothing authentic or original, the cup of bread is microwaved dough that stiffens almost instantly after hitting the table. I'm a huge foodie and do my best in trying new breakfast/brunch places and sadly, this one left a sour taste in my mouth. The staff is great and attentive but the food didn't measure up. Sorry Rise & Shine.... I tried.

UdNoKJwLj6ymKHCYVLffbg.text: We went to Rise and Shine twice last week with visiting family in town. We had a lot of small children and the restaurant was more than accommodating by letting us sit outside even though it didn't look like that section was probably open. Maria was our waitress the second time and she was so nice attentive. She kept refilling out water and updating us on food. And speaking of the food - it's great! I had the gravy and biscuits and chilequiles on my two visits. The portions are definitely lagged enough to share. Highly recommend this restaurant, whether you're going alone or with a group of 20!

fixwDu2x9DgGDJ3nlb4Leg.text: I'm so sad about this. Was very excited for this restaurant to open as I live a block away and after 3 attempts I'm going to have to give a thumbs down. Food is greasy!!! Very greasy. As in my veggie egg white omelette was greasy? Why? How? Tried to change it up but still had an overall bland oil taste. Restaurant appearance is cute, no wait times (though I understand why) and super cute merchandise though!

0B7bex8_lKHCk3gGUH-zUg.text: One of our favorite places to eat breakfast. The food is always delicious (the mug bread with the sweet cream cheese butter is my favorite). Three service is always wonderful especially Maria. Definitely recommend this place.

NZgfBEgLwjmu7sisX0Ui1g.text: A solid, good place to have breakfast if you're in the area. I had the philly steak and egg breakfast while my mom had the chicken and waffles along with the coffee. She loved the coffee too. The food was delicious and not too salty like other breakfast places, and the all meat was tender. Maria, our waitress, was attentive and professional.

vWJC-guhMBRuypoux3S6Xg.text: New favorite breakfast place!! Food: amazing. From the steak & eggs to the corned beef. Do not miss the cup of bread. So good it should be illegal. Our server Maria was spot on at every turn. Will definitely ask for her next time and every time. Better hurry, this hidden gem won't be a secret for long.

yiJFOVUIpQAMc8exzzo3lA.text: Been here 3 tomes and each visit has been wonderful!  Steaks are cooked to perfection.  Love it!

ZCPh0gQ0W6g16l6H0hTu7Q.text: Our first time here and it did not disappoint. Service from when we walk in to service at our table was outstanding. We picked this spot because they had Spam and eggs. Hubby ordered the Hawaiian breakfast and he said it was delicious. Everything was delicious.  We will be back on our next vist to Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Henderson, NV, United States. Hawaiian breakfast, ham steak breakfast, bacon and cheese omelet and biscuits and gravy.

vvZlWg8X9DAm4ajwbq8BEw.text: I came into rise and shine as a first time customer around noon today. It was quite busy! I was greeted right away and ordered the French press. My server Noel recommended the Ultimate breakfast which was so good! She told me they were known for steak and eggs and had a very inviting way to direct me to my breakfast choice. The eggs and steak were cooked perfectly. I will be back again!

wxcRCJ34iejJwPnlatQoFg.text: Hands down best steak & eggs in town.  Also love their crunchy French toast.  Delicious!

-kARG3f6MS24YCqG8Li-SQ.text: Gotta love the good old standard steak and eggs. I'm only in Vegas for about four months at a time but I come here at least once every month 'cause I can't get enough. Friendly service and great steak. What more could you want?

zJnCXxdzmeMqMplhwsvJEg.text: Really good! The food and service is solid! Only bummer its the wait sometimes but with good food, that's expected i guess!

-gMxIoIt1D_UnvUFn8RryA.text: Henderson just can't get enough brunch spots. They have been popping up like crazy over the last couple of years and I love it.  We stopped in around noon on a Saturday and to our surprise there was no wait for a table. Our waitress was over quickly to greet us and take our orders. She was friendly and continued to check in us during our meal.  The Pot of Bread sounded intriguing so we shared that to start. It is a combination of a cinnamon roll and a roll. The combination of a sweet and a non-sweet is perfect. The frosting to go on top was delicious.   I had the Spice-Rubbed Rib Eye Steak Chilaquiles. This was very good. Their presentation was like a deconstructed chilaquiles and while I wasn't a fan of the presentation I did love the flavor of everything. The steak had a great seasoning and enough fat to additionally flavor the steak. The chips also had a nice seasoning and the perfect amount of cheese coating them.   My husband as always ordered the better of the two entrees, the Southern Style Chicken Fried NY Steak. The fried steak was perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned. The gravy on top was delicious. I would definitely order this entree on a return visit.

UKjAHgiABhHOkz4O9_9dSQ.text: Wow! What an amazing place for breakfast! Along with the amazing French press Lavazza coffee option the menu is chock full of amazing diverse options. The service is fast-paced but do not seem to hurry YOU. I brought a book and settled in with my carafe of French press coffee for the long haul and left pleasantly surprised. CnHX4BEAxnFwUD2zfDm9sg.text: The worst place ever service suck wasn't even busy could ever bring me my toast before I ate my meal. Wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy.

-dYU90CzA-HMVRmlGYKaVA.text: Ask Maria, she makes you feel like you're at home. We had the classic eggs Benedict and it didn't disappoint. We ordered the French press coffee, which was Fun treat.

Ek7IAdESmNjiQ1Wz4-QM8Q.text: We came here for breakfast today for the first time and I was not impressed at all. Food was ok but on the heavy side and the experience was not great from the moment we walked in until we walked out. From the moment we walked in, I asked if we could be seated in a booth (three adults and two toddlers and plenty of open booths). The answer was no and then the guy mumbled something - no idea what. Whatever, we sat at a table - not a huge deal but I wished the request was handled in a nicer way. Once we sat down and we ordered I asked for the kids' menu egg to be soft boiled egg. He repeated it and then he brought back (and he even presented it as such) - "a hard boiled egg". Then, I ordered an iced latte in a to go cup. It was brought out in a regular glass (I put it myself in the kid's cup, so I can take it with me). I had the veggie eggs Benedict - it was not bad but very heavy. It comes with potatoes and a lot of sauces on top and while it was ok, I would not eat it again. We came here because of the reviews and because I wanted to try something new but will most likely not return. The pro is that the place is nice and has a small outside patio but it is not worth it because of the bad experience.

b4FbfBEp4wNhiBw3Lwc9hw.text: I've been here multiple times, and it's always satisfying.  I have been to the Southern Highlands branch and both restaurant have great decor and a lovely staff.   Today I had the Cup O'Bread and the Rib Eye Steak Chilaquiles and boy, was it tasty. I asked for a medium rare steak and did they deliver! The steak was juicy and nicely charred on the outside, giving it an authentic smokey taste. Though this may have been the main part of the dish, the ranchero chips may have slightly outperformed the steak. Their chips are housemade and seasoned with a multitude of spices, with a basis that seems to be paprika and cayenne pepper. The chips laid on a bed of refried beans and was topped with eggs (any style you choose), avocado, cheddar and cotija cheese. The chips were still crunchy and was served with a side of sour cream and salsa. I recommend getting overeasy eggs, so when you break the yolk it adds an extra sauce to your chips.  Overall a very wonderful experience and I can't wait to come back!

mnHYm4GMUVPtVw6_vPlTyg.text: I live very close and decided to try this with my mom and friend this morning. Service was great! Sat down right away, my waitress was so helpful and answered all my questions. She brought out the wrong beverage but realized it before even putting it on the table and quickly went back to fix it! Their omelets were well seasoned and delicious. I would definitely go back!

zX55T96e5YTTjUNFQnzQRw.text: Breakfast being my favorite meal of the day - I had to try this new spot in Green Valley. Upon entering I was greeted and sat quickly. After 5 minutes of not being approached by a server, I asked a hostess for a cup of coffee and to find my server. Server appeared a few minutes later with my cup of coffee. He apologized and said they were short handed and they are still trying to work the kinks out of a new restaurant.   Servers are  inexperienced and move very slow. If I could offer one tip for the servers that would be to treat your section as one big table vs. 4 or 5 individual tables. Stop making a trip into the kitchen each time you leave a table. Stop, make eye contact with your customers to see if they need anything before disappearing.  I found the coffee and the food to be much better than the service. Hash browns were crisp on the outside and flavorful inside. The ham steak was thick and juicy. The eggs cooked perfectly. I opted for the cup of bread instead of my usual wheat toast. The cup of bread is a bland cinnamon roll with frosting on the side. I think this would be good as an appetizer but didn't care eating it with my breakfast.   The prices here are crazy expensive for a neighborhood breakfast restaurant. My bill worked out to be $20/person with tip.   I would come back here for the food, but not very often because of the service and the price.

Ut4nsy7ZfwIY7LwmJYWuyw.text: If your going to request anyone, request Sharon! She was very attentive and just made the experience better! The food was also very delicious! No complaints, all around a great place!

vr-NMsz4TGUHSjXB5G0HSA.text: The food is always amazing! And to make it even better, Michael made our experience very enjoyable with his excellent and accommodating customer service. So far, a few of our favs are the buffalo chicken and eggs, the veggi avocado bagel sandwich, and the pork carnitas burrito minus the tortilla making it Keto friendly ;) This is our Saturday spot!

At first before i realized that was the theme, I told my husband how shabby our waitresses looked and she should've atleast put the effort in to making her ponytail neater instead of messy and lopsided. g-73szORpXFt0Ni-sjTt-Q.text: I have visited Rise and Shine on many occasions, I live clear in the North East Las Vegas and I am willing to make the long drive to this location in Henderson for a great breakfast. Their menu selection has something for everyone in your party (assuming you don't have strict limitations like kosher, vegan, paleo and all that stuff that I fortunately don't care about. although I did see some stuff that may fit some of the healthy needs) they have sweet dishes, savory dishes. My personal choice for this trip was the corned beef hash with a pot of bread...if you haven't had their pot of bread I highly recommend it! The rest of my party all had something a bit different, Chilaquiles, some amazing looking steak bagel benedict and a dish that I can't recall because I was too busy stuffing my face and enjoying a nice morning cup of coffee. I will say that on this visit it seemed like my coffee was a bit cooler than I would like, but the service from Maria made it ok, she topped our drinks off frequently and made sure we had everything we needed on this visit. The prices are a bit above average for a sit down breakfast and lunch place, expect to pay around 14 to 18 per person, but the quality and portion of food makes it a way better choice than just swinging by McDonald's or I-Hop. Price is fair for the food period. If you are looking to have a great breakfast with your significant other or a group of friends, check this place out. The servers are all wearing pajamas, so if you roll in wearing yours, you might get asked for a refill or something :-)   Dishes that I enjoy cinnamon crunch french toast thing Corned beef and hash Steak bagel benedict thing two fisted bagel sandwich  Pot of bread

p8dpExTHHbWpBDaH2UZovQ.text: My husband and I LOVE this place!!! They have the very best steaks we've found in town. Seriously, the are comparable to the steaks you find in some of the fancy steakhouses...only half the price. We went yesterday and got the steak and egg breakfast and...Wow! The steak was juicy, tender, cooked perfectly and had lots of flavor. It was also HUGE. We ate the leftovers for breakfast today. Maria our server was really cool too. She took very good care of us. We used yo go to the one in Southern Highlands but now that we have this one, which is much closer, we will definitely be coming back soon.

tIEQBrZtrxAchHqLF3wq2Q.text: I gave this place five stars because the coffee, eggs, and pancakes are all exceptional! I love that you can order their house coffee or an individualized French Press of Italian, I think Lavazza coffee brewed to your deepest darkest preference. Of the three times we've visited, Rise & Shine has proven to be exactly what we want in a neighborhood breakfast joint.  Great food, nice folks(employees as well as customers), in a fun casual atmosphere.  Maria served us in her PJs, with attentiveness & positive hospitality! She is easy going, yet professional and got us what we needed for our almost two year old daughter who was on the brink of a meltdown and in that shrieking mode. Thank you, Maria for your patience!! Thank goodness there were crayons and fun little paper menus for her to go crazy on. I don't know why I am always surprised the food is so delicious. It's almost gourmet, but presented in this coffee shop style restaurant. Seriously, the pancakes are fluffy and moist and kind of had a subtle orange flavor to them today, which could've just been from the juice of the fresh orange sliced garnishes. The Maple syrup is served HOT with a side of fluffy real butter. If you're looking for a more low carb meal, then the spinach, chicken & egg white omelette is packed with protein and FLAVOR. Just remember to substitute the breads and potatoes for tomatoes and avocado. Maria and the kitchen are very accommodating. I'm pretty sure the tomatoes were tossed on a pan for two seconds because they were sooo good, just melted in my mouth! The kids menu offers a variety of mini breakfasts, and is seriously a decent amount of food for your little ones!! Mini egg and steak, mini egg and crispy bacon, mini yogurt cereal and fruit, mini waffles etc. Hubby ordered one of their steak Mexican breakfast burritos and he loved it. It was oozing with all kinds of spiced delights. I had a hard time staying away from his side of beans. Whatever is in those is friggn addicting. Oh!! And The Bloody Mary's are da bomb! They decorate them with a whole hard boiled egg, peppers, & olives, which honestly is like a meal in itself! In fact, I can't  wait for the weather to cool down so we can just ditch the car & walk there to indulge in those Mary's without worrying about a designated driver! I wonder how many carbs are in those drinks? I guess if we're walking it doesn't matter as much.  So, is it obvious we'll be back?

75pst6zlhdRUeZCmAesSFw.text: Went here at like 1 on a Friday. There was almost no one there, which is fine. Their menu was smaller than the one they have online. I was looking forward to a chicken wrap, but that whole part of the menu wasn't there. Same with the kids options, if you wanted to eat lunch items, they have only chick fingers and a grilled cheese. I had to buy my daughter a normal burger for like $11, and knowing how big it was, we could've shared. It also took 30 mins minimum for the food to come out. Happy to know it's fresh, but maybe bring kids food out when it's ready?  also they charge $3 for a soda, even for a soda for kids in the kids cup, which is 1/3 the size of my glass. All and all I wasn't super impressed. The food was seasoned well, but I think $45 for me and my two kids is a bit much.

93yOL3kIUAz_S1um12Zo9w.text: We came here for breakfast, and I'll never forget our experience. And that's far from a compliment. It was an early weekday and the place was empty. There was literally only one other table, party of 2 being served. With all the great reviews I figured we got lucky with our timing (wishful thinking).   We were seated right away. Our waitress, who wasn't serving the other table, came over with the menus and gave us a minute to look at them since we had never eaten here before. Well, that minute turned into about 15 minutes. Maybe some people like a long time to look at the food options, but usually a waitress comes back in a few minutes to get your drink order and then asks if you'd like more time to look at the menu. At the very least, we could have been offered water, but nope. When she finally decided to come back to our table we ordered a coffee, water, and a smoothie. She was in no rush. I don't expect people to go running around, but getting a coffee and water doesn't take 10 minutes. Especially when you're only serving 2 people. Now granted, maybe a nice fresh hot pot of coffee was being made. Nope. The coffee was room temperature, if not cold. We ordered 2 classic breakfasts and then we waited.........and waited, and waited some more. In the meantime, I wondered if she was going to bring the smoothie or bring it with our meals. Roughly after 40 minutes had passed, she brought our food and no smoothie. We've all had a time in life where we forgot something, we're human. I had hoped to get my smoothie an hour ago, but I still thought it would be nice to have with my meal. I nicely asked if she forgot, she said yes, and that she'd bring it right out. In the meantime, I was hungry and started to have my breakfast. I really liked the bacon and...it ended there. The eggs were like anywhere else. Nothing special. Not that I expected special eggs (lol), but since their prices are higher I thought maybe they'd taste a little better or higher quality than somewhere much cheaper and reasonably priced. But they didn't. Now the hash browns. This is a matter of opinion and/or acquired taste. I love hash browns. But...I really wish they specified on the menu that these were not your plain old hash browns. I don't know exactly what was on them but they were strongly seasoned. I'm sure there are people who love them, I'm just not one of them. I thought I was getting just plain old hash browns. So after sitting there for about 25 minutes, talking and picking at my food, I accepted the fact that I was never going to get my smoothie. She never came over for coffee or water refills, so I didn't even have a chance to ask a second time (technically 3rd time, 2nd reminder).   As we are finished with our meal and waiting for the check, she comes and brings the smoothie. I nicely asked if I could have a straw, and she rolled her eyes and had a real attitude about it. Seriously??? I've been sitting here for an 1 hr and 30 minutes waiting for a smoothie that I nicely asked twice for and you're pissed off because I "nicely" asked for a straw, which by the way was in her apron pocket! It's not like she had to make the 15 ft walk to the kitchen to get one. To top it all off the smoothie wasn't cold, it was melted, and clearly had been sitting out this entire time. I was pissed, and unlike her, I had a reason to be.   We didn't want to wait 30 minutes for our check so we asked for ours, and a to-go cup for the smoothie. It was expensive and I wanted to ask for a refund, but we also didn't want to deal with her anymore and I thought maybe I could chill it at home. Within 5 minutes she brings our check and no to-go cup for the smoothie. What a joke. We got up, paid the bill, and as I was walking out the door she came over and said she would go get my cup. Shockingly, she actually brought it.   I think it's obvious why I'll never come back, and highly discourage anyone from coming here.

iPZdySBv0S1K-_d4cb0npw.text: Been here a couple of times, they do know how to cook their steaks to the right temperature. Im also a fan of their bread in a cup, never actually seen that anywhere ( basically cinnamon bread on a cup ).  Mariah, our server was very nice and  always checks on us if we needed anything.  Overall, good food and good service. 5/5

CxjUON27AM5CQCCPerV6Mw.text: Cup of bread was nice and warm. It tasted pretty good  and I've never had anything quite like that before. One of the better corned beef hash I have had in the area. It was nice and crispy! Great texture! Service was super fast too.

AHeJf6ZJv5Dv1AXjk2rsFA.text: Amazing food. Makes hash browns the way I like them, crispy and flavorful. My bf's steak was amazing. Definitely coming back.  Everything has STRONG flavor, nothing bland.  Prices are also good.

YHJNy6gggqF8rxuo2mZspQ.text: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: The food is pretty good here. The upside-down umbrellas are cute. The space is cozy, a kinda "we're starting up an independent coffee house on a budget" cozy. But your visit here, depending upon what you pick from the menu, will inflict significant pain where you sit on your wallet.   There's two things missing from the Rise & Shine website. (1) A listing for this location (idk why) and (2) all the prices from the menu. Yep, management deleted the actual prices and replaced them with $$$ signs. That proves management knows full-well that their pricing comes on way, way too strong.  Example: A slab of breakfast ham & eggs, $13.25. Houston, we gotta problem. That same plate at Village Pub is about $9. And over at the Longhorn Casino it's just $5. Now I know those three venues are vastly different, but you have to admit that a slab-of-ham-and-eggs will NOT be that much different at those three venues. I mean that's a plate that is going to be tough to screw-up ... or lift-up.   Another example: Bagel sandwiches. Turkey+avocado bagel sandwich or chicken+egg+bacon bagel sandwich. That sort of bagel sandwich. They come in at the $13 price range, with a side of fries. I saw two of them presented to the booth next to mine, and they do look large & scrumptious. But you know this is a breakfast joint, and when I think about the whopping tasty breakfast bagels they serve up at Einstein Bros. for about $6, even though they probably aren't going to be as yummy as these, I still just have to say "no" to the $13 option here at Rise & Shine.  The venue itself, as I said, cozy. The colorful upside-down umbrellas hanging down from the ceiling, a nice touch. It looks as though they are mounted to fan motor posts, so maybe they can be powered up to spin, idk. But if you look closely, management has really made a very minimal investment in decor here. One big painted wall with some huge raw-wood letters that spell out "Shine All Day!" Another wall has a cut-out silhouette of a cow sitting on an egg. Oh, and they do this other cutie-thingie here where the wait staff is dressed in PJs. Cozy, cute, but nothing that screams out "of course the ham & eggs are gonna be $13 bucks here." The background music is relaxing, best described as "the soft side of 1970s rock."   In terms of food, customers apparently seriously favor three items here: the rib-eye & eggs plate, (that comes with) 'cup-o-bread' and the house Bloody Mary. I had 2 1/2 of them. My Bloody Mary was virgin, also sans any Bloody seasoning. What people out in the real world call a tall, thin glass of Clamato juice. So it was only $1.75 instead of $9.00. That's OK with me. I hit it with some salt, pepper and hot sauce outa the caddy. Besides, I love Clamato juice; I'll take a Bloody Caesar over a Bloody Mary any day. And I like finishing breakfast with an extra $7.25 in my pocket (that I didn't drop on a shot of Svedka).  The cup-o-bread is quite yummy. Basically it's a hot, freshly-baked, mini-mini-cinnamon roll (baked inside a little tea-cup), served with a side of melted, heated cream cheese icing to use for dipping. Again, yummy/tasty, but you know it also seemed to taste a lot like that Pillsbury pop-the-edge-of-the-can-on-the-counter-and-bake-it-up stuff. Hmmm, I wonder if ...   The rib-eye (& eggs) was a welcome surprise. No wonder it's popular. Check the pictures. This is not one of those bargain-breakfast "well, technically, I guess you can call this a steak" steaks. I mean this is a honest-to-goodness real & generous cut of rib-eye. Not "the best rib-eye on Earth" rib-eye. But very real, very tasty, nicely marbled, nicely charcoal-ed rib-eye. As it should be, since the plate, with a side of tasty/crispy grilled hash browns, was $16.50. And--believe it or not--the third egg was an upsell, bringing the plate to $18.50. Ouch! We're not far off there, price-wise, from an entry-level rib-eye DINNER.  RECOMMENDATION: A cup of their Lavazza coffee + your laptop = a relaxing morning hour spent here. While doing that, you can look over the menu and decide cautiously upon your next move.

y3GR3h0Fs2lEHCbY7drLiA.text: My wife and I decided to try this place out with my brother and his wife. It's new to our area and we are always looking for a good breakfast spot. Needless to say, we were not disappointed!! We started with their fresh juice, coffee, late, and a Bloody Mary. Fresh juice was really good and reasonably priced. Coffee and late were both good but nothing over the top. Bloody Mary was unique and had a great balance of acid sweetness and alcohol. for starters we tried their Cup of Bread and I definitely think this is a MUST try. It's everything a cinnamon roll should be, but better.   For actual breakfast we had a burrito, cinnamon French toast, red velvet pancakes, and eggs Benedict. Burrito was massive and full of eggs meat and hash. Benedict was savory and rich with a balsamic glaze that definitely balanced out the fattiness. Cinnamon French toast was crunchy on the outside and chewy and tender on the inside. Their syrup is served hot and has a great flavor to it. Red velvet pancakes  were really sweet but not overpowering. They had chocolate chips cooked in which added an extra layer to them.   Without a doubt a place we will be going back to!

7g4hlyJ0Afrl_F7Z2axqhg.text: Such a great place - with such a great menu! Ashley was our waitress and she was fantastic, super friendly! Large portions and the cup of bread was a great treat. Will be coming back for sure!!! Love the coffee options too.

3pSqNnZujDPJUiTEOSlNNg.text: I tried our new breakfast place but was little  disappointed with all the high rating they have. The location was perfect, the waitress was very nice but the food was very average, you can pretty much have it any place in the city. Maybe I order the wrong thing, next time I'll have the rib eye steak with eggs, will see if this improves. The prices were 15% higher than most places.

Ej3BqZkK2iZtNTrTcBGzIg.text: Nice selection of egg white omelets.  Friendly staff and open floor plan. Would be great if they served steel cut oat meal - a much healthier alternative to reg oatmeal. Also a breakfast bar would be nice.

Esz_a3HkDnjRX1rnLfdzgg.text: First time here and definitely impressed.  Home like feel.  I am a ribeye steak and chilaquiles connoisseur and this place has both together.  I am usually disappointed with restaurants ribeyes, but definitely not disappointed here.  It was cooked to my liking.  Great flavor.  The chilaquiles sauce was very tasty.  I will definitely be back.  Hard to find good food like this.  My only complaint is they don't have flavored coffee creamer.  In today's day and age, not having flavored creamer is a def no no.  Service was very friendly and our meals were delivered pretty quickly even on this busy Sunday morning.

iLsPDKKPyR3_qT8f6h8biQ.text: Love this place!  Never a bad meal here.  Maria was our server and she was great!  The Eggs Benedict seemed to be a big hit.  I had country fried steak which was very good.  Their fried chicken and waffle is my favorite.

aRUNrA9cSxbiN7ZFwJdWfQ.text: This is my regular breakfast spot. I come here about 1 time a week, and I'm always happy with the service and the food is amazing. Maria is always such a helpful server. Thank you !

C6sTSrcpXJru1IKkZOMyFg.text: We are visiting from out of town and wanted to find a nice place for breakfast off the strip. This place was PERFECT!! And our waitress, Laura, was an absolute dream. Great food and even better service. Thank you!

mdELhuU2eFk5v0eC7igS7Q.text: Came here after my gym session ,  It was So delicious! I had a BYO omelet.  And it was so good . Maria was extremely helpful , not only did she explain the menu to us , but she made sure we were taken care of!   It was an overall great experience ! We will be returning !

OqjOqXQu_goZt3M4MkNb8w.text: Customer service was very poor. Never did they come around ask how were doing if we wanted a refill on my empty glass of OJ. I had the rib eye steak and eggs my eggs where excellent  the way i wanted them to be, my steak and hash browns where a diffrent  story i asked for medium rare got it pretty much rare with a charcoal  burnt taste to it so i had to drench it in A1 sauce, not so much appealing to the eye and taste. Nice 10 oz steak but poorly cooked and seasoned, my hash browns where just over fried nothing but a hard crunch every bite of the way the toast was just like biting in to a rock. Over all i rate it 3 stars.

9GFywWzNvtDb0s-bk-y-qQ.text: Fun place, nice options for breakfast, great Lavazza Coffee (#1 Coffee in Italy), traditional breakfasts and health conscious options available. Upbeat, cheerful staff offering great service.  Recommended. No outdoors or pets allowed.

RGsk_-G12ddlBFD07O-RGQ.text: Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day. All day everyday. Rise and shine offers something a little different than the typical egg joint. Most meals come with a bread in a cup, basically a delicious tiny warm cinnamon roll ! And they also offer some fresh juice choices like watermelon, which is a refreshing addition along side orange juice. I ordered some child silver dollar pancakes for my daughter and my husband and I ended up eating the majority of them, the flavor was so good. I expected a standard plain pancake but they is a flavoring I can't place in them that made them good by themselves. The portions are also a nice size, enough to eat the whole plate if you very hungry but not too much to feel like a pig (I don't really like left over breakfast food). I'd say the service made me minus a star. It was a little slow and also impersonal; know one looked very happy to be working there, or checked on us during the meal.

gpozrsfbHl0k107GJ_7tUw.text: The omelette was the worst one I've had in my entire life . Cheese was not even melted. The avocado was black and brown. The servers were nice and fast service. But the food was horrible.

RejBy6Zt2svO5iSLCIvPpQ.text: You can't beat the breakfast at Steak and Eggs! We are not locals but still make sure we go every time we're in town. From the friendly staff (we had Maria today and she was great!) in their pjs to the fun merch and the DELICIOUS hearty portions of breakfast classics, it's a must visit! I especially recommend the carne asada steak breakfast burrito... so good!!!!

iIicrviZncOQBN9zhkbILQ.text: The food here is bomb! Maria was our server and she was very polite and held great conversation. I'm definitely coming here again.

rZFtZHXywwtWVf0LYl196Q.text: Maria was our server and did an excellent job on filling our drinks. She recommended the steak and eggs ( which we had heard about from yelp). My husband had it medium rare and it came out perfect. The steak was very flavorful. I had the smoked salmon eggs benedict which was very good with plenty of salmon. We will be back.

c-SvF07_lcSiSARA4jSSCA.text: I have gone all around Vegas to find "the place"  to go and have not only great food but excellent service.  After having great service from the lovely Sharon,  we were blown away by how delicious the food was. We did not expect that high quality of food from a small diner. Can't I give 6 stars? You definitely won two new customers for life! Really recommend this place to everyone.

OVys_SOjfIkYld1nm08A4A.text: First visit to this restaurant. Decor is bright, lively and comfortable. They make good use of the many windows, and there's an outside eating area.  Staff uniforms are pajamas - very cute and different.  Food is delicious. Went with the basics - eggs and pancakes. The syrup is real, heated with cinnamon sticks - a unique twist but not overpowering, just a hint. I use these basics to judge - if they can't make a good pancake, not worth the bother. Not True here - light, fluffy and delicious. Also like they offer full and half stacks!  Next visit will be more adventurous.  Service was friendly and attentive.  Only minor complaint - coffee drinkers don't get a saucer, so have to improvise for my spoon.

VMnLM-5WMtrxrG_enLqBKg.text: We sat down ordered our food. They brought it out in a timely manner and completely forgot about us. Not once did they come back and ask if I needed more coffee, water, etc. I sat around for 20 mins waiting for my check. I had to call for a manager and they brought out a teen who apologized and tried to give me a $5 coupon to come back. I told them to keep it since we won't be coming back. Don't come to this place. They don't care about customers. They only care about profits. Really disappointed. Everyone else around us didn't have a problem. Just us. Go somewhere else. This place sucks

GiSJmqTCCv7v-_BRHFxfew.text: I got the chicken egg white omelette and it was amazing!!  Maria was my server and she was friendly and kind! My food was ready before I had a chance to finish my cup of coffee. I would recommend Rise & Shine Steak & Egg to those looking for a local breakfast spot in the Henderson area!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Henderson, NV, United States

7A9B-bBDa3RK4kWpiU-odw.text: This is my 3rd visit to Rise & Shine @ this location & have requested Maria as a server.  Although we can rate ONLY 5 stars, Maria deserves 10 ********** stars!!! She's the BEST that there is!!!  She's extremely polite, professional, patient & kind & is TRULY an asset to this company.  Hiring more Maria's & having her to provide training to new employees would be beneficial to the company on a wide scale.

G9outFky45kfT-aDlL4fCQ.text: I went to eat breakfast there today, as it was our second visit. Sharon, our waitress was very attentive and did a great job. However we waited about 30 minutes for our food while the table, who had just sat down 10 minutes prior, received their food quickly and before us. I ordered a steak omelette -after all it is called a steak and egg place. The steak was not edible. It was extremely fatty, yet impossible to chew. I tried two different sections and had my husband try it also. We both had to spit it out. Sharon, again, was fabulous and very apologetic. She sent the manager, Gilbert, over.  I own my own business. I understand that sometimes anything that can go wrong does. That was the case with us. However Gilbert wanted to lecture me on the different types of steak. He also told me that sometimes entrees come out sooner than other entrees, to try and explain why the table next to us got served immediately and why we had a 30 minute wait. He said he would take the price of the steak off of the entree and only charge me for an omelette. He never offered me a new steak. He also was not apologetic. So for a the horrific experience today he gave me a whopping $3 off. Obviously it was offensive and any good manager would have gone above and beyond!  Based on Gilbert's treatment of us, we will never go back!  However if you choose to go task for Sharon!

-mWh5NPGHyLjsjlRc0LElQ.text: My husband and I found this place about a year ago!! Food is awesome!! The cup of bread is absolutely amazing!!!  Service is good as well. Today our server was Maria. She was friendly and service was good!

HJeHOJjjf2ke-dreFpBy_g.text: On our way to Lake Las Vegas and decided to Yelp for a good brunch place in the area and we ended up here... BEST DECISION EVER.   Located in a corner of a little strip mall, interior is fun, bright, and colorful. Servers are in PJ's (must be nice!) LOL. Cool upside down umbrellas on the ceilings. They sell some pretty fun merch like shirts with witty sayings, socks and different kinds of stress balls.   Let's talk food... First of all, you can't leave this place without trying their CUP-O-BREAD. Tastes like a cross of a cinnabon with a brioche bun, baked into a cup with cream cheese dipping sauce. I made the mistake of sharing. I would've devoured one... or two by myself. Steak and eggs, yes. Perfectly charred and seasoned on the outside but medium rare goodness on the inside. Tender, juicy, and flavorful. The chicken and waffles was okay. Big enough to split between two. Forgot what the name of the vegetarian everything bagel sandwich was, but it was good. The loco moco with spam... so delicious and big enough to split.   Service was exceptional. Special thanks to our server, Maria. She took good care of us. Thank you! We will definitely be back when we're in the area.

k7wEouBW7HL0ZOUAaE0fWQ.text: I wanted to grab a quick breakfast before Sunday errands.  This was a spontaneous breakfast stop and I'm glad I stopped by!  Rise & Shine Service:  Greeted as soon as I entered and told it would be 5 minutes before I was seated and it was exactly that.  Mike was my server and was a rock star in a packed house on a Sunday morning.  My coffee was kept fresh as if I was the only patron in the restaurant.  Fantastic. Definitely a time for a #tipthebillchallenge  Rise & Shine cuisine:  The menu is packed with some great options and I went with the XTRA Protein & Egg White omelette.  Delicously packed with protein and flavor: grilled steak, chicken, bacon, cheddar, mushroom, onions spinach and salsa..oh my.  I grabbed some wheat toast for carbs and paired with some freshly brewed bottomless coffee this was a win.  Rise & Shine ambiance:  Friendly staff attitudes adorned the dining area along with pastel colored walls and flowered wallpaper area. Bright colored inverted umbrellas hang from the ceiling.  Positive slogans adorn the walls and they sell some equally bright clothing that by the entrance.  Rise & Shine is only a couple of miles away and I'm kind of shocked I've never stopped by before.  Great service, flavorful and interesting breakfast dishes will get me back. I'm definitely eyeing that Loco Moco, but that's another yelp tale. Good Morning! =)

JT6yc99Hcn7C-TUwgZBWFw.text: Quick service by awesome server Maria - delicious coffee, and food:: we ordered the pancakes, the Rise & Shine Burrito with both red and green sauce,chilequillas & steak - everything was hot and incredibly delicious. It's the best place to try the flavors of this part of the country! But the star of the show was the steak & eggs - the waitress Maria told us she was super excited for us to try it - the coffee rub was beyond delicious & salty & slightly crunchy - the best kind of steak you want in the morning. It was better than steak last night at Guy Fieri's! So good and affordable!

B4REikoX0EVWB0MWI6_3Pg.text: This place is very cool! My girlfriend and I decided to give it a try one morning for brunch. The decor is very pleasant. I would love to stay home and work in my pajamas!!! They serve Lavazza coffee. Coconut Milk is on the menu! And... the food is really really good!  My girlfriend had Eggs Benedict, which was delicious. I had a chicken and avocado omelette, which was also delicious!  I truly think we'll be back!

Most of my regular breakfast places always have a wait and cram the tables together to fit more in, so this was a pleasant surprise. I'll be back!

ik8Kjsb0vsjQpt5t4Vg4CQ.text: 6 stars wouldn't be enough This place is everything that makes a breakfast place awesome!  Menu- menu has some great unique items. They say it's a steak and eggs place and they mean it! They have Truely unique steak and eggs combinations. They clearly marked and explained gluten   People- half of going out is the people. Or server Mikey was great, so happy and his suggestions were point on. He was attentive and yet not intrusive. Gilbert the manager was really great as well. The fact that they wore old school pajamas was an added bonus!

tLsZHCCGw8ts2pnbLKbNPQ.text: This has become our favorite place to eat brunch on sundays. The food is amazing with good portions, with a wide variety of options to choose from. The service here is incredible, even on Mother's Day when they were very busy, the staff made sure we felt taken care of.  Maria was beyond awesome today, she kept our coffees and other drinks filled and checked in on us often. I tried the bacon and egg in a hole French toast. It was amazing, cooked perfect and very tasty.   Overall my favorite place to have breakfast or brunch.

f8L0U6uPmSPEXaYNYCjBsg.text: NEW FAVORITE BREAKFAST SPOT Came to Rise & Shine after an amazing yoga session with a HUGE appetite..  First I suggest you look at the menu before you come because it can be a bit overwhelming! We started off with a specialty appetizer (avocado toast) and freshly squeezed orange juice because I had no idea what to order! After about 20 minutes and a tremendous amount of help from MICHAEL I finally decided to go with steak chilaquiles and a side of green tea. The steak was cooked to PERFECTION and absolutely blew my mind.. I felt like I bit into at 4 star steak house steak. Extremely impressive My friend ordered the Avo-veggie-Benedict and that as well was wonderful.  From the delicious and tasty food to Michael's outstanding customer service and extensive knowledge on the food menu pertaining to any questions we had, in just blown away. Will definitely be returning and with more friends and family next time! Thank you Michael!!

This location is the best one I have been to in regards to the service which was top notch the entire time we was in the resturant.   We also ordered the country ham steak which was a little on the mediocre side. Do your self a favor and stick with the staple this place does. Get da steak and eggs!!!

The balsamic glaze that is on the Ham & Eggs Benedict ruined it I felt. I love balsamic & put it on many things but what they used had a bite to it like pepper. Back of my throat burned after a couple of bites & throughout the meal.  Service was great from the waiter but the busboy that kept trying to take our plates that contained food & we were still eating which was annoying. Giving it 3 stars as there are other items on the menu I wouldn't mind trying & over all experience was ok.

flqJ1T5bNuYoULa7eFJlsw.text: Place has been open for 7 weeks already. Came here with my buddy. The loco Moco and signature ribeye chilaquiles were off the hook. Our server Maria was great! bZBtfTwNhyfUdl3lDb_olg.text: I use to go to the southern highlands location, then the summerlin location. lucky for me this location is a 5 minute walk. aRQUcH_5jm1gGiU0cTdPoA.text: Wonderful new breakfast place! My boyfriend and I stopped in today for a bite to eat. The environment is warm and friendly (with lots of windows). Felt good inside. The woman who waited on us, Maria, was kind and knowledgeable with the menu. I ordered the cinnamon crunch french toast w/ sliced bananas. It was amazing! He ordered an omelet with chicken & avocado. Also very good. We will definitely be coming again.

WzCpTm6v4H6nnUDjbJ2mFw.text: Came here for some brunch. There was a short wait and the service was friendly. The waitress told us our food was delayed because there were large parties before us. It took a while for the food to come out but they kept filling our coffee while we waited which was nice. I enjoyed the avocado Benedict and my boyfriend enjoyed the rise and shine burrito. The decorations were also very cute and unique. A good brunch place.

WZNx4qyEy6YIzrAwRqG59w.text: With so many breakfast choices, it baffles me why anyone would return to Rise & Shine. Initially, the food and service were good. But the past two dining experiences were awful. The food didn't come out for almost an hour, and when I complained, the staff gave me a $5 certificate -- rather than comping the meal. Today, I decided to give it one last chance. I ordered a "small" portion:  turkey sandwich with cheese. Out came a lame pre-packed couple of turkey slices with a couple of slices of cold swiss cheeses. All served on "Wonder Bread-style" bread. When I asked for a slice of lettuce and a tomato, it was brought to me. But the substitute of fruit for fries (I'm a healthy eater) cost an additional $2.95. The fruit portion was pathetic. I will NEVER return. Bad food. Uncaring owner.

Pteg7Ve1pExdZQobv_k39w.text: Average at best! WAY over priced for the quality. I got the cup o bread with my breakfast, over baked then over microwaved tough and chewy.... yet crunchy and dry on part! Had the ham steak and eggs, eggs were fine, ham was ok. Hashbrowns were cold and over cooked, and the green onion in them were burnt black. Coffee and breakfast with tax was $17.43 for one. And that was with the regular coffee. The French press coffee is almost $6 for 3 refills. Probably won't be back.

wXi53WOwyzPmc-5przMzYw.text: Great service,  but the food was just ok. For a professed "steak and egg" place, they didn't have a t-bone steak meal. Also,  no choices for syrup,  you had to use their house cinnamon syrup if you wanted syrup.  Won't return.

Sl2mbmfDa3ZJIJK0_Z9pMw.text: I was really impressed with this breakfast spot! I don't know how they cook their pancakes but they were so delicious and the service was great. It's so cute that the servers wear pajamas and I loved the decor.

ah4Q2PCMcj4-R-AawoR0qQ.text: First time here. It was great. Our waitress was Laura. She was the best. Even the busboy was a great assist. Try the cup-o-bread!

G3agxUD-JfARwa40TBeP8Q.text: Not sure why breakfast restaurants are always chaotic. Probably a combination of hungry hungover adults and hungry little wild children. This place is no exception. The check out is in the front door walkway. Kind of bazaar. This place is always extremely busy. It's very easy to get stuck and lost at the entrance.

H3t0rPYZuKTHP5c49abbCA.text: A wonderful place for breakfast or lunch. The decor was nicely done with colorful umbrellas etc. Our waitress Maria was dressed in PJ'S which was cute, she was pleasant ,accommodating & explained everything on the menu. Our food ( Breakfast) was excellent and enough of it. We can't wait to go back!!

21C8DkTvLRtwH-wk26jb_w.text: The food was delicious.  The service very pleasant and fast.  Loved the pajamas the the staff wore.

vjyobXbv_60m6i7I_sbp_g.text: Worst experience. If you're visiting from out of town just understand that the locals seem to be given priority. I came in with a party of four, place was busy was told wait time about 10-15 minutes. I saw bigger parties waiting. A waitress cleaned a table suited for 4, not a couples not for 5 or 6, for 4. So I thought I'm next after waiting the suggested time. The. This older guy with a much younger female come in and a very old looking waitress kind of gave them a wink and waved them in. Mind you this couple was at the desk waiting to check in and the old waitress had them skip when the young hostess wasn't looking. I was annoyed because they took the table for 4 and now I had to wait, i suppose twice as long. I'm sure they didn 't miss me but I will never give them my business. They should either teach their waitresses to respect all customers or replace them with some who will. Also be mindful that we as customers are are expecting to have the best treatment, earn your tip.

6FJ-FjDuZJTLyrQgtGrJcw.text: This is a great place for breakfast.They have the best hash browns,made with green onions added.Very pleasant staff.This will be our new go to for breakfast.Love that they have a senior menu!Only complaint one of the staff had a T-shirt with their slogan on it,that was not for family to view.Just not a good example for a family restaurant.

WLHwer8fwBr5HVYJF8mGPg.text: Awesome!!! Food is consistently great and staff always friendly. Just left from having breakfast and had Laura Jean as our server. She was great!

yvWgPYv1iC7Ld45snnEsUQ.text: I was a little intrigued when I saw the sign go up on the old Annie's Italian space down the street from the house. OK, I love breakfast,  will have to try it. I'm a bit of a snob when it comes to chicken/country fried steak and will judge a restaurant based solely on their execution of my favorite dish. I figure that a place with steak in their name had better nail it so I order it and anxiously await. Service time was a bit slow but I'll give it a pass as place was pretty swamped. Plate arrived and presentation was nice with country gravy on the side. I was very pleased with my choice, perfectly cooked with a nice batter and high quality piece of steak. Nothing worse than paying top dollar for some frozen disc of questionable meat from a bulk pack bought at Costco. Wife enjoyed her avocado veggie whatever.. Will be back to try the corned beef hash.

C6Z8V3QuQZEnNtSi6-fCRA.text: Had the most wonderful breakfast here today! We had the pleasure to be served by Mike, very professional, helpful and kind! Rise & Shine should be proud to have a server of his caliber. We will defiantly be back! Food was over the top delicious!

PALb4zJer_XHWT8-EzvFWw.text: I'm just going to start off with I'm never coming here again. It's not that I had some atrocious experience, but this place just really isn't that great - especially for the price. I've had much better food at much shittier restaurants and that's saying a lot considering the value. They play country music, which to me is mind boggling since the number one response to "what music do you listen to?" is "anything but country". The service is mediocre I went an hour before closing and the server made me feel like I was inconveniencing her for having to do her job. The interior is surprisingly tawdry as well, it's like they substituted everything in a Greek restaurant for even tackier decor. Plus they sell a bunch of crap that could only be categorized as "Things grandmas buy their nephews after going to Church but before they have brunch". Do yourself a favor and go to Kitchen Table or Served.

DmKItbhUjVtT3ILzFO2Bhw.text: Rise and shine offers Kitchen Table style food quality without all of the pretension and snobbery.  The wait can be lengthy but once seated the service is swift.  Tried their avocado Benedict and a classic steak and egg dish. And Sharon treated us (including our dog) like royalty on the patio.  She made sure we had a table with maximum sun exposure, thoroughly answered all of our first timer menu questions, and made time for small talk.  We'd come back here first before going to the other 500 Henderson brunch restaurants again.

Oi6yNajNOjIioo4ElBkGWA.text: Alright, overall the food was good. Between the 3 of us we finished our breakfast. It wasn't anything that knocked out socks off. My steak was cooked as requested. cumGyOYFremiYgo1U1GWjw.text: Maria's service was impeccable!! Everything was delicious!!!! Mimosas on a Saturday morning is the way to start!!! Be back soon!!!  I would love to go to work in my pajamas!!! Everyone was really nice!!!

SE2Ow2o3NZ2Dzyu9YcdLqA.text: First time here and I will definitely be coming back! I had a cappuccino and eggs benedict. Our waiter Maria was super sweet and the food came out relatively fast.  Great breakfast joint!

ti6m2_4EnCk7Ghsw4dG4ow.text: Found a new breakfast and lunch spot on Yelp and it delivers in service and flavor! I'm all for pancakes and waffles-the usual, but sometimes I'm craving for a hearty breakfast without all the floury carbs. Rise and Shine centers their breakfast go-to with steak and eggs, but they have all the classics favorites too. Our server, Maria, was a ray of sunshine friendliness. Even the host, was cheerful when seating us.  I ordered a coffee with cream and it was smooth and strong. I had to order their popular rib eye with eggs and potato hash. Just a note, Maria did let me know the hash brown has green onions in it, but you can request your hash plain if you like. I don't mind green onions in general, but next time I think I will have my hash plain, but if you do want it more savory, go with the green onions. The rib eye steak was tender and well seasoned with pepper and not too much salt. The poached eggs were perfectly runny inside and flavorful. The Build Your Own Burger was definitely home made and was delicious. It wasn't densely packed together like frozen patties and tasted fresh. They also serve alcohol here if you want to get your brunch on with something bubbly. I also was wowed by the bread in a cup. It's like the center of a cinnamon roll in a little cup with a cream cheese frosting dipping sauce. It was steaming when I tore into it. Sometimes a little flour carb is ok and when it's this good, it's a must try.  All in all, this place is a hit for me. The service is excellent and the food can back it up. The place is very clean and I think it has enough charm to be a local favorite. Definitely will be back and highly recommend.
