lwUBPr8nAtd8B-k4oZOqnA.text: Tasty breakfast. Chorizo breakfast burrito was good, big enough to split. Decent prices

qo4ONMdUMhxiFeGWFZrZGA.text: I got here with my son around 130/145, they close at 3.. the place was empty, the hostess was friendly and seated us right away. I was with my son, who is very much into coloring as well as eating crayons .. anyway, We sat there for about 10 mins before our server came over to us, in pajamas, which I thought was actually pretty cool.. I asked about the freshly pressed juices, they had a strawberry & watermelon combo which she let me sample before getting a full glass, the sample was tasty, and I ordered a glass and a coffee as well, the glass of that juice was not delicious, after a few sips i couldn't drink any more, it tasted kinda off.. i had ordered regular coffee and they didn't want to brew any more so she got me a french press instead which i was excited to try but it was disgusting, that's not her fault at all, so i got a cappuccino instead which was delicious..   my son was coloring on his kids menu, then he proceeded to color the window.. you know what, I'm that a-hole parent, i let my son do it BUT I made sure the crayon didn't screw up the window,  it wiped clean and before we left I made sure both windows in my booth area were cleaned of any crayon mess.. At one point, my son turned away from the window onto the wood with his crayon and before I could get up to stop him myself, my server took my sons hand and proceeded to remove the crayons from his hand.. he was not happy but seriously, under no circumstances should anyone touch another persons child without permission from the mom/dad/parent.. THAT IS NOT OK! I know what my son was doing, and i take full responsibility for his actions, especially IF he would have damaged something.. I did not share my feelings with the server as I was not going to make a scene, but once the crayons were out of the picture and he was calmed down , we ordered food which was good, not amazing but good.. Carne Asada Burrito and a Kids breakfast with eggs, bacon & pancakes..   She dropped the bill for my convenience which I appreciated, i had money out and had asked her if I pay up front or at the table and she said up front, so i planned on paying as I was leaving.. several minutes go by as my son is still eating and I noticed it was about 2:30 and people were bringing in signs from outside that were advertisements for this restaurant.. my server sees me still at the table with my son and she comes and takes my money to the front for me off the table, I stated "uh I'm about to leave.." but then she brought me my change and said "have a nice day"..  Long story short, DONT TOUCH SOMEONES KID WITHOUT PERMISSION..

jJ8LP0TXJ9qWzZVHjSuopQ.text: Hello, and welcome to Rise & Shine (Henderson). We are big fans of the original, so we knew we had to check this one out. We arrived and expected a wait but were sat right away. Soon after drink orders were taken and we were given a few minuted to browse the menu. The menu was mostly like the original with a few exceptions, so we had a good idea what we wanted. I ordered the chicken fried steak and Josie had the french toast. My Chicken fried steak was of course quite good. However, it did have a different flavor than what I remember and it may be the batter. Either way i was quite delicious and I ordered more gravy because I can never have too much. The french toast was as usually quite delicious and seasoned and cooked well. The staff as usual was attentive and on top of our beverages. I might add that Josie had the hot chocolate and it was visually stunning as well as tasty. Thank you for eating at Rise & Shine (Henderson). Yes, we will return and I am sure it will be as great as it always is. So, go and get some good breakfast. you won't regret it.

tDO04j_hjGp-ymrpFhzNlA.text: Kind of a fun (and busy) place with good food.  Had about a 5 minute wait for a table in what is a very small waiting area, but that was the only downside.  Server was quick to our table, the coffee cup was filled regularly, as was the water glass.   I had chicken fried steak and eggs and it may have been one of the best I've ever eaten.  Large portion, plenty of gravy, and tender.   We want to go back and try the bread cup and chicken & waffles.  Can't wait!

S5Ey-jVNz4ZWEQuhwuKaMw.text: Have eaten at Rise & Shine in Southern Highlands several times before but they have really gone done Hill and raised their prices several times. The steak came out burnt and was told it is only the coating on the steak. It does not say on the menu they put a blackened coating on the steak, nor does the server tell you when you order it. The service has also gone down hill, had to ask for coffee refills and never brought me honey after asking twice. The Manager was less than sympathetic and really did not seem to care that customers were not satisfied.    Don't know what happened but the table next to me must have had a similar experience as they got an left shortly after their food was delivered.

ZId8DA03b5sPhTBNcLlfiw.text: Drove by and saw their sign, heard amazing things from friends and checked them out on Yelp. Great reviews and great pictures of the food. Being the foodies my husband and I are, we decided to try it. Such a warm welcome from Laura and she really explained the menu and gave great suggestions as well! My husband ordered the Loco Moco and I ordered the Steak and Eggs. I cannot wait to try it! I've never written a review before I've received my food, but the welcome was so wonderful and Laura is so genuinely sweet I had to write. Will update after we get our food, but we know it'll be great!

Br_kKLilNB5oOWPePGfEDw.text: This was my first time here and Maria was super helpful with the run down of the menu! I got a pressed watermelon and strawberry drink and before I knew it, my food was already on the table. The service was fast and the quality of the food was great! Going to come back very soon!

h9cpB6vLbNtdhE-3_Ycwig.text: Pricier than some other breakfast spots. Asked for my eggs soft scrambled and they were over cooked so that was disappointing. Besides that, the food tasted pretty good.

TLEb7Ru17qsy7GOYcIlvcQ.text: Came for breakfast on NYE and had the chilaquiles and biscuits and gravy with eggs OM and a fruit cup. Breakfast is okay enough that I wouldn't refuse to come if someone requested to meet here for breakfast, but it's not my favorite spot. It's better than a few other places in the valley, but I have a few complaints:  1. The prices don't match the portions. Why is the biscuits and gravy $11.75 when the biscuits are smaller than my palm? This is a fairly cheap dish to make and serve and you can get bigger, similar if not better quality biscuits almost anywhere for less. Peg's for example serves B&G bigger than my palm for $7.99.   2. Service is bad. Maybe our waitress was having a bad day, but I had to remind her about bringing coffee and never got a refill-- it wasn't a busy morning and we sat down after all of her other tables had their food.We didn't see her again until she came to drop off the bill. My husband pointed out that they had to bus their own tables for some reason, but why isn't every waitress offering coffee warm-ups/refills to nearby tables to mitigate issues like this?  I used to be a waitress, so I can extend some understanding but... c'mon.   3. Stupid problems. There are too many people congregating by the door/cash register between needing to pay and needing to sit. It's a clusterfuck.

Q-399ekcs-w3PfFh9aKsBg.text: Their menu has a great variety from oatmeal and yogurt parfaits to Benedicts and Ribeyes. The cup o' bread is cute af and their servers wear pajamas!   I've been wearing the consequences of being a foodie so I was trying to be (somewhat) healthy in my choice. I had the AvoVeggie-N-Eggs Benedict and it was just as decadent as a red velvet pancake. So dang yum. A whole mashed avocado on a perfectly crisp English toast with grilled tomato and spinach with the obligatory poached eggs and hollandaise. Came with a side of hash browns I probably should have asked to substitute for fruit or something. I'm new to this healthy thing

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Henderson, NV, United States. AvoVeggie-N-Eggs Benedict

vhvfDC1p7IZ1AEpvBLqNQQ.text: I wasn't expecting to like Rise & Shine as much as I did. I always assumed it was one of those bland breakfast places with humongous portions that my parents would love so I have put off trying it until now. I  mean they sell socks and other random items by the register and the servers wear pajamas so it kinda reminds me of a tourist trap you'd stop by during a road trip.   BUT the food was actually very tasty! I mean the portions are huge so I was right about that. We got the chicken and waffles and a breakfast burrito. The chicken and waffles were so good! The chicken was more flat and similar to a chicken fried steak but didn't really taste heavy. The burrito was pretty standard but I'd still order it if I was craving a breakfast burrito. Good coffee choices too! I like that you can order iced coffee. Our server was super nice and checked on us a few times.

ue0oIt4TGgcjBHc0wSH_PQ.text: Our new favorite breakfast place. Love the cup'o bread, cinnamon French toast and the breakfast burrito is enough to share! Service is always great. Been there 3 different times and always a really good experience!  We'll definitely keep coming back!

wHOgakbFAkpU3YD11DEBxA.text: Really nothing to write home about. Conveniently located at a shopping plaza, you never have to worry about parking and it's located at a generally nice part of Henderson. The staff are very friendly but I still had some trouble getting our waitress' attention for simple requests like more water or napkins. The menu is pretty good with a wide variety to choose from. The food on the other hand does not match the prices. The taste of the dishes we ordered didn't even come close to the somewhat expensive prices. I've had way better at mom and pop or old school diners for way less expensive. You could argue quality or bring up non GMO or whatever with me all day but I don't go to restaurants to pay for bland foods when I can make Those at home for way less.

Bg9fxPVZYAmmc4-XGppLvw.text: I'm adding this brunch place to my brunch rotation.  The service can be very inconsistent - it was extremely slow the first time but excellent on return.  The prices are decent and everything felt well seasoned.     We tried their Crispy Fried Chicken Breast & Waffle, the 3 Little Pigs Bagel, their Ham-N-Eggs Benedict and their Steak & Eggs breakfast.  I loved that the Chicken and Waffles came with warm syrup.  The portions were good (not massive like Hash-a-go-go, but everyone except one person at our table had leftovers.  Definitely worth a try!

4AkT0kL1j0wIzvj8fB3wAQ.text: Traveling from Arizona, always looking for great food spots. This place did not disappoint at all. Had the Philly Cheesesteak Egg omelette and cup o bread. Food heaven. Amazing flavors and great staff. Waitress and hostess were very sweet.

lMEtLh9RaR931Cqf6doR6w.text: After driving by this place a few dozen times decided to stop by for brunch today and I am very glad I did.   The place is very whimsical. Umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. Gorgeous metal sculptures of their chicken and cow themed concept. The print on the booths added another fun pop of color.   The menu was robust and a little overwhelming. I was torn between a few things and took our waitresses recommendation for the chorizo and steak burrito. Our waitress was super nice and friendly. Made our first visit a pleasant one.   My burrito was very ok, but had potential to be so much better. The overpowering flavor in the ranchero sauce was too much. There was so much chili-powder (90% sure it was chili powder but maybe paprika) that it dominated my palate. Everything I ate after that sauce tasted like chili powder. I'm also pretty sure I just got the steak burrito since I didn't get any chorizo. If I did it was unnoticeable visibly and tasteless. The burrito as a whole was also really have and the flavor profile was depthless. There was almost so much going on that everything got lost. I couldn't pick out a single ingredient in that burrito when I took a bit.   Trying to figure out if my burrito was bad or if everything was bad I separated it out to try each ingredient. The steak was delicious, cooked perfectly. The beans were ok, but similarly had too much of whatever was in the rancher sauce. Eggs were eggs. I realized that the ranchero sauce was just so over-powering that everything in the burrito was overcome. It didn't allow any of the ingredients to shine which is unfortunate because the steak was good. I decided if I went back, I'd avoid the ranchero sauce and opt for the Rib Eye and eggs. Would be worth the extra $2 to get the steak and eggs without whatever else was going on in that burrito.  My wife got a burger and it looked delicious. I didn't think I'd point out shoe string fries as being a plus, but they were seasoned perfectly. Had the same restraint in the ranchero sauce showed, I imagine it being way better.   Service was good and for the price the portions were appropriate. I'm going to go back and try something else, because I left wanting more. Just more of something else.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Henderson, NV, United States. Build your own burger with avocado
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Henderson, NV, United States. Steak and Chorizo Burrito

tbZRogcZDlW5tTFq4Ogitg.text: Last week, my husband and I found ourselves over near Green Valley Ranch, and VERY hungry pretty early in the morning.  We pulled up our trusty Yelp apps, and found Rise and Shine.  We're big fans of the original Rise and Shine location, so we opted to come here to try this one out.  We had the place to ourselves for most of the time we were there.  It is a bright, open spot, with plenty of seating.   Diamond was our server, and she was very polite, and was able to answer any questions we might have, including some odd ones.  We ordered:   Cup of bread:  This...I remembered being different at the other location.  I thought it was served with butter, but it was served with a cinnamon icing sauce instead, and dusted with powdered sugar.  Good, but not what I remembered.   Smoked Salmon Benedict:  This is, quite possibly, the best benedict I've ever had, and I eat a LOT of bennys.  The eggs were poached perfectly, the hollandaise was delicious, and the smoked salmon was a wonderful addition.  This was served with hash browns and they were perfect as well:  crispy but not burned, and very flavorful. Steak and eggs:  My husband orders this every time we go to breakfast, no matter where it is.  He ordered 2 eggs over medium, and a medium rare steak.  The steak was definitely more on the medium/medium well side, which was extremely disappointing, however, it was seasoned VERY well, so we both were still able to enjoy it.  His has browns were a little anemic looking, no crispiness on top at all.    All in all, this was a better than average visit.  I'd really love to see the steak cooked to the requested temperature next time, but everything else was quite good.  I anticipate that we will be back again soon.

aLDEmzCYDXNUTTerFMCGGw.text: Had a great experience until checking out and paying for meal. Was promptly given a table and waited on. My waitress was delightful (they even wear pajamas, how cute!)The food came out quick and was delicious. Even the maple syrup was warm. 10/10. But upon paying, was met with rudeness and sarcasm. I won't return for a second visit.

This was my first time here and it won't be my last. Also as a side note the menu has plenty of options for those on keto.

keJr8r4baQQY3k-tLDeAyw.text: Before I went grocery shopping next door, I decided to stop in and have breakfast. I ordered the 2 eggs, bacon and hashbrown plate. The scrambled eggs were fine, I'm not a fan of thick cut bacon (cooked way to well done) and the hash browns were a tad undercooked, a bit more crispy  would have been better. I did enjoy the bread in a cup with the cream cheese sauce.   My server Maria was nice and was pretty attentive  but what got me was I could hear her asking the other diners to come here on Yelp to give the restaurant a good review because they needed to get there numbers up. The competition in the neighborhood within a 3 mile radius is pretty competitive and I would have to say the selection is better.

He was very attentive, available to answer all of our questions and extremely helpful.  The food was incredible.  We tried the chicken fried steak which was actually a steak, not a cubed steak, the buffalo chicken breakfast and the bananas Foster waffle platter.  Every single thing was delicious.  We will definately be there again!

I work night shift, so I sometimes want breakfast and sometimes dinner- this hit the spot- a little of both. The staff was great and the food was fresh and plentiful. 4FTm0tgzI9dBENK93055Ww.text: We are always on the look out for a good breakfast spot. This is located in a very busy strip mall but we had no problem finding parking close. When you walk in your eyes instantly go to the ceiling where they have brightly colored umbrellas with flowers on them opened up and facing downward. Some of them are on spinners. Very cute idea. The waiters and waitresses are dressed in their pj's. Yet another cute concept! The menu seemed very healthy. Some gluten-free options, fresh squeezed juices, etc. They are supposed to be known for their steak and eggs.  I am not a huge fan of steak and eggs so I ordered the Banana Foster flake pancakes with 2 eggs and a banger sausage. Banger sausage...interesting just one came with the meal. It isn't your normal greasy sausage..interesting.. it is actually kind of hard to describe but it was really tasty. Now for the pancakes...delicious. I am not a syrup eater so for me the pancakes were just right. Enough sweetness and the crunch from the corn flakes was perfect...a griddled  banana was on top along with whipped cream and nuts. My man loves country fried steak and eggs...he said it was really good. It is made with a NY strip steak. He ordered a side of a biscuit and gravy and he said the gravy they used on the biscuit was different than on the steak...it did look different, not as much sausage and thinner. He preferred the gravy on the biscuit. But he said all in all it was a good meal. I had the fresh squeezed watermelon and strawberry juice. Mmmm mmmm mmmm. I am a sucker for anything watermelon though! :)  We hit the restaurant at the perfect time because after we sat the place filled up!!!  We will definitely be going back.

-Y5QnmN6BpnLrPiy0Ib3Sg.text: I've tried two Rise & Shine locations and both times I've had issues.  Southern Highlands location - Once seated, it took close to more that 15 mins to get our water,  30 mins for the server to take our order and another hour to get our food. We've seen people get seated, eat and leave while we were seated. Totally unacceptable.  We spoke with the manager but did nothing about it.  Henderson Location - Thought I'd try this new location out. I ordered for pickup. Low and behold, I had a very long piece of hair in my food. We called and spoke with the manager and requested for a refund but we needed to go back to the location. Once at the location, the manager was no where to be found.  Got the refund from the host but WHAT A WASTE OF TIME.  I DO NOT RECOMMMEND GOING TO THIS PLACE. THIS PLACE IS A JOKE. I HAVE HAD BETTER SERVICE AT DENNY'S.

IduZ9kc648k-P4pIyc5NhQ.text: Decent breakfast place. I'm not sure if this location and the Flamingo/215 location have the same owner/management, but the other location is superior.   Service is hit or miss.   The ribeye has great seasoning, but isn't always the right temp. I like a medium steak and have gotten it both very rare and well done here. If it's done right, it's pretty good.   The hash browns are different and good.   The chicken and waffles are okay. Nothing special. Ask for buffalo sauce (if you like a little spice.)  The French toast is delicious. Crunchy and good.   I do not recommend the biscuits and gravy. The biscuits are tough and the gravy is bland.   With a few changes, it could be a 4 star place.

I walking in and did not like that the host greet me... so that kinda sets the tone a a bad not reason for only 4 starts   With that said I love the menu and the selection the use a good coffee bean and they have French press Omg that is a super treat for me I love French press    We ordered eggs Benedict..... holiday sauce was nice the poached egg was perfect me personally did not care for what tasted like a A-1 sauce  drizzled on top with ham and holiday sauce it had it to salty for my taste and of course to each there own    We had the crunchy French toast it was nice I am a traditional French toast girl so it did not give me that much excitement but the bread was nice and the syrup was warm nice touch   Noel was our server she was good not overly good but satisfactory average  Over all this place is a great place to eat I love the decorations .... of your looking for something nice on a Saturday or Sunday with great choices on a unique menu in a good way yes I would defiantly recommend this place...... rOxVQj1I_W7gIHfV5w1sKw.text: Rise and shine... Because when YOU shine bright, you give permission for others to shine their inner light too!   My 4 year old, 13 month old and my sister met here for breakfast one hot Vegas morning.   Waking in, I caught eye of one waitress, and thought to myself, wow, those look like super casual comfy pants to wear to work. Then I saw the another waitress and noticed they all were wearing pajamas! Cute idea, it's like we stepped into their home and they are fixin' up breakfast for us.   When you come here, it's essential to order the Pot of Bread. It's bread baked in a small coffee cup. The top portion is cinnamon bread. And it comes with a side of sweetness to dip the bread into. My 4 year old daughter thought this was so much fun!!   We ordered the steak and eggs, after all, that's what the restaurant is named after! The steak is rubbed with a coffee seasoning. I'm not a coffee drinker, but OMG, this was delicious! So much flavor! My sister and I split the steak, enough for two, but sensible enough for one if you have a big appetite. I also substituted the potatoes for fruit.   My sister, who is classic in her own right, had a classic Belgian Waffle. I snuck a bite, and it was sooo delicious. And they ONLY have REAL MAPLE SYRUP. I really appreciate that!! I do not like high fructose cheap pancake syrup, so when they brought out a bottle of real maple syrup, I was sold! Great waffle. I'll be coming back and ordering that for myself next time.   My daughter had the 1+2+3=6. Clever name. It's 1 egg. 2 bacon. 3 silver dollar pancakes. We substituted the bacon for fruit. The silver dollar pancakes were on the larger size, very good.   The high chair for my 13 month old was a good height for the table.   We will be back and will also take out of town guests here because it's great food, some unique menu items and fun experience. Totally recommend!

t2JsGbdz1T6-Oql0Eak1Mg.text: Heading out of Las Vegas for that drive back to So Cal, and wanted to grab something to eat after a quick stop at the outlet stores.  Due to my bad judgement in distance we ended up in Henderson which was a good 15-20 minutes away in the opposite direction of where we were going, but figured since we were already there, lets give it a try. We were not disappointed.  On any Sunday in So Cal finding a breakfast place without a wait is always a challenge.  Rise and Shine is located in a strip mall with plenty of parking and while the restaurant was full, we were seated right away.  I had already done some homework and knew i wanted the French Press coffee and the Pot of Bread.  Both are fantastic and worth a try if you go.  The coffee comes with a neat little egg timer for different strengths of brew which is a nice touch.  The Pot of Bread comes out steaming hot and when you slather the cream cheese spread on, its heavenly.  My companion decided on the homemade Corned Beef Hash and eggs, and while she prefers canned Corned Beef, nope i don't know why, this is the first homemade Corned Beef that she said she would come back for.  I had to have the Chilaquiles since that was big on the Yelpers list, and of course had it with the Rib Eye.  If you are hungry this is the dish, the portion is huge, and full of flavor.  If your travel plans allow you to swing through Henderson for breakfast, Rise and Shine will not disappoint.

cZahtGxbTrkiimtq9-RFAg.text: This was my first time at this location but I've been the other 2 quite a few times.  I enjoyed this location as much as any of the others.  We were seated quickly but it took a hot second for our server to touch the table.  However, once she did, we had great service from her.  I will say I'm glad we didn't have to wait because the area in front of the register can get quite crowded.  We did have to wait to pay and it was awkward.   The food was good (as it is at the other locations).  It's not gonna knock your socks off but it's not bad either.  This is a solid place where you can get a consistently good meal.  I will say if you're not expecting the steak to be heavily seasoned and charred, this is your warning.  It is.  That's just how they do it here and you either like it or you don't.  Luckily for me I do, so yum yum!!!  Great place to make your regular breakfast spot!

dbN32gq0dqgc4d68bmBoZg.text: A friend and I stopped in here for breakfast this weekend and I was delighted. We were greeted and seated almost immediately and the hostess was very friendly. I was initially taken aback by the variety of socks they have for sale. I didn't purchase any, but they were a fun mix of witty and artsy.  Once we were seated, I immediately took notice of the decor. They have spinning umbrellas hanging from the ceiling! The decor was very cheerful. We were then greeted by our attentive and pajama-clad server.  The menu was expansive--there's really something for everyone. We decided on splitting the vegetarian eggs Benedict and red velvet pancakes. What a treat! I really enjoyed both entrees, with emphasis on the cream cheese "syrup" that accompanied the pancakes. Both portions were generous and I was overly-full when we left.  Overall, I really liked this spot. The parking lot is a bit hectic, but that's not their fault. Henderson is a bit of a drive for me, but I look forward to coming here again.

After being remade twice the chef came to the table and told us he could take  a picture of the steak in the back, because back there it is mid rare but in our lighting it looks close to well.   Wtf lol.  Today when I asked the server if our eggs were over easy she said "sometimes our cooks aren't perfect"    Lmao.  I'm using that one, girl !!!   Most the time the service is questionable.  Today it was descent.   I only come here for the Bloody Mary.   It isn't even vodka, it's saki, but it is sooooo good.  Praise them pickled eggs !!!! I'll be back.  I don't complain anymore. IjzqMmqwSv-z-PP0-1AZfQ.text: Maria was out server and she was the best. From making sure my steak is cooked right and simply checking up how our meal is. I reccomend her as your server you wont disappoint!

xu34WJyItrDWZr8Lcmxubg.text: I don't live far from this wonderful breakfast place. I brought some friends last weekend and had the lox omelette. I was so surprised to see this on the menu and since I love smoked salmon I thought I would give it a try. My wonderful waitress Maria, accommodated me because I don't prefer to have hash browns or toast and she happily swapped out the toast for tomatoes and the hash browns for fruit. It was a perfect combination. My buddy had his daughter and she had the waffles which she loved. He had the eggs with corned beef hash, which he said was great.  I enjoyed the meal so much that I came back this weekend to give it another try. Plus I wanted to write a review because I love to see local restaurants succeed. The lox omelette has capers, onions and it sits on a bed of spinach which is just a wonderful combination. Another bonus, they have a outdoor eating area that is dog friendly.

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Henderson, NV, United States. Veggie omliet and avocados to make avocado toast

xy3rz-QAVQZ9szKgaPNlpw.text: I went for the steak and eggs, but they didn't both shine.  Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place has expanded enough that you can call them a local chain. They started out elsewhere but opened this Henderson outpost almost a year and a half ago. Since then, they've clearly enjoyed success because it was quite packed when I came here for Saturday morning breakfast.  I was fortunate enough that my friends had arrived a little earlier and secured a table for us. It took a little while to get our orders in and such because it was crowded, but the food come out quickly enough and the check can be settled at the register near the entrance.  I had "The Ultimate" ($17.50, or $18.50 if you add one egg), aka the Ribeye Steak & Egg Breakfast. It had a bread option which was sent out to our table first. I went with the catchily named "Cup-O-Bread," a roll which was half cinnamon and half not-so-sweet. It was quite soft and moist throughout, perhaps a bit too much so at the very bottom. I also enjoyed the cream cheese sauce, which was served as a dippable side. It wasn't sickly sweet, thankfully.  I was very glad when my food first arrived, but the steak itself was visually and texturally not as I'd expected. It looked to be cooked rare rather than medium rare, and parts of the outside looked too charred, an observation which later tasting confirmed. Most of the steak wasn't as tender as I'd hoped for. It may be a notch above discount late night steak & eggs, but it should be at least two tiers higher given the price.  The rest of the dish was solid. The hash browns had enough salt and crunch. The poached eggs were quite impressive, aside from the residual poaching water in the serving vessels. The whites were soft, and the yolks were super runny. You can count me as a fan of the eggs at least.  I may come back to Rise & Shine, but it won't be for the ribeye. I heard that the country fried steak at my table was really good, and there are plenty of other options including waffles, benedicts, burritos, chilaquiles, juices, and alcoholic beverages. It's just too bad that they didn't succeed with their namesake.

bQ1yCZMvtuYTy0Eb9afRRA.text: I love this place!! I bring everybody who comes into town here and try to frequent here once a month. Mike is usually my server, I have gotten one of the ladies but I always get his section and I won't ever complain about that!!  Had the waffle, opt for no powdered sugar and no whipped cream because I'm a whore for butter and their warm maple syrup *insert drool emoji* Added the 2 eggs and bacon for $3.50 and it did not disappoint...got my eggs scrambled with cheddar cheese...eggs were perfect and not dry. Love love love.   I always get the resh squeezed orange juice because, it's just that awesome and something I can't pass up.   My brother got the two fisted 3 little pigs bagel & egg sandwich and couldn't finish it because it was so big. He opted for the fresh fruit platter in lieu of hash browns and shared it since it was a lot.   He got the michelada with a tajin straw and he would not stop raving about delicious it was!!!  I will be back again and again!!

fy41UOqm_0YE277JJl_j9Q.text: I tried this place out today and I was pleasantly surprised.  The restaurant itself is very cute with colorful flowered umbrellas hanging from the ceiling.  The service is friendly and prompt.  I ordered a iced caramel coffee with coconut milk which came with whipped cream which I wish they told me about but I still drank it and it was ok.  I ordered the fancy steakhouse omelette which comes with a side of hash browns and a bread option but since I'm trying to limit my carbs they were able to replace the sides with an avocado and fruit.  I like that the omelet came with good size pieces of steak that were perfectly cooked and a pretty good portion! I'd definitely come back!

1aPjCLtssa8z_u_qb07KfA.text: My family loved this place. I took a rating pole and it was 5,5,5,1. I was the 1. Living with carnivores I love finding places that can accommodate both carnivores and vegans. When I saw their menu with a ton of vegetarian options I had high hopes. Unfortunately it wasn't to be. I ordered the chilaquiles with beans only, no cheese. They advised me their refried beans had animal fat. I was kind of shocked. If you have tons of vegetarian options, it would be a simple and smart choice to make your beans vegetarian too. I could have ordered many things on the menu with the beans. Instead I was left with a side of hash browns and avocado, which is the token sad vegan food at a breakfast place.   On a positive note my husband and son loved their Ultimate steak and egg breakfast. They have you cut into the steak when it comes to the table to make sure it's just right. My oldest got his with the cup of bread, which is half biscuit dough mixed with cinnamon roll, twisted and baked in a mug. Served with a side of cream cheese icing for dunking.  My son said it was good, and really liked the cream cheese based icing.  My little guy had the Philly  cheese steak. He was a little sad it didn't come in an egg sandwich form, but built his own using his toast  The servers were friendly, and all dressed in pajamas. They sell cute socks here, we got some with Spam on them. The decor is nice, and it was in a nice location with easy parking. Overall we would come back, I think I would just eat before hand.   A note to the owner. Subbing vegan refried beans would satisfy so many people and open up a lot of your menu.  There are a lot of families who are carnivore/vegan combined and it's never fun to be the person at the table eating either a dry bagel, or plain hash browns. Your chilaquiles could easily be made totally vegan and probably become a WOW menu item if advertised right. Another easy option would be to keep your refried beans and offer a plain black bean.

tMoq8F0XOrZP3lhIrGMs5g.text: The food here is really good however service is very slow. I know they just opened but wait time for a table is long and even longer for food to come out.  The first time we went our server kept disappearing and never came to check back on us. Had to ask for water multiple times.  Second time they dropped off an iced coffee in a tall glass with no straws. I had to flag down another server to get one.  The food took over 45 mins to come out and bc of that the manager (I think he was the manager) came and apologized and said he would take off our beverages for us.  We got the check and the drinks were still on there. By now we just wanted to leave so we didn't say anything and went up to the cashier. Our bill was $51ish and she said our total was $70ish.  We asked to check and told her there are some mimosas on there that wasn't ours.  She insisted it was our tab.  The manager came by and we had to tell him and he said sorry and took off the alcohol but still didn't take off our coffee he promised.  Again, beyond annoyed at this point and now running late to our soccer game bc we didn't realize breakfast for a party of 3 (2 adults and 1 child) would take 2 hours.  Like I said, both times we came to this location the food was great but service is not up to par.  Unfortunately we will not be coming back.

x-1_-cszUOFZ0MtQ3J67bQ.text: as a former restaurant owner in phx. i dine out often and like to try new places. the first time i tried this restaurant i ordered the chiliquiles. upon arrival it appeared to be just a plate of slop. the flavor wasnt much better then the appearance. yesterday my friend talked me into going again. looking at the menu it showed a bagel sandwich which looked good. the waitress informed me it was just a picture and i couldnt have it. for goodness sakes it was a bagel with egg bacon and cheese...i ended up with hard eggs greasy hash browns the best part of the meal was the orange slice. wont be going back

YKgN82rK_cPz48uvGNCp-w.text: my gf and i come here pretty often since we live down the street. normally love it here. the young man in the black and red pj outfit has amazing customer service each time we come. but today we got served by the older lady in pink pjs and she just wasn't as friendly, don't know if she got annoyed because we switched up our orders a few times but sheesh that's just how it is when you work in the food industry. anyways, i think you guys should fix your policy on how if we don't get meat/protein you should substitute it for something else. Ex: we got the salmon and bacon bagel, we don't eat meat so we asked to substitute more salmon if we don't get bacon. She said we couldn't do that. I asked if we could sub for avocado instead and she said that's not an option either, we would have to get it on the side for an extra cost. Most food places offer substitutes if you don't eat meat. I work in the food industry and we don't charge extra for replacing meat with avocado? :-)

Lh7gnboYh_z5eLcqcyItRg.text: We love the decor of the place; it's bright and cheery.  Love that the servers wear flannel pajamas.  The restaurant is clean and so are the restrooms.  The servers were friendly.  We were worried about the size of the pancakes so our server let us know we could get a half order.  That's great because we didn't even finish the half order!  I had the banana pecan and Frosted Flakes pancakes and hubby had the regular old fashion pancakes with a side of scrambled eggs and bacon.  I really enjoyed the combination of bananas, Frosted Flakes and pecans and the fact that they serve warm maple syrup.  The issue for both of us is that the pancakes were dry/overcooked.  Now that's better than being undercooked as extra syrup can help with a dry pancake.  The eggs were overcooked as well.  Bacon was good.    We got the French press which was pretty good.  It was a dark medium roast.    We would come again if we're in the area because based on the reviews, we suspect the chef just had an off day.

VDpTs-hQpQX7TV8sLKXBrg.text: I've been wanting to go eat at this place for a long time, so I was ecstatic when my sister took me to brunch one morning. khXbJFsiJBYbt1OtvnRi7w.text: I went there this morning we were the second table in the restaurant I waited 40 minuets for my steak chilaquiles for $17 dollars and it came out well done ( I ordered medium rare) and they weren't busy at that time

emTJ2M1sC_62WAcHagnXVw.text: Terrific place opened up a few months ago for breakfast/brunch.  The food is delicious and plentiful and reasonably priced.  We have eaten there several times now and have not been disappointed.   There is something for every palate on the menu from voracious meat eater to vegan.   Service is excellent. Today Maria was a star holding down the fort almost single handedly and taking good care of our 3 person table.  The menu is extensive and full of tasty choices.  I've eaten the Salmon Bagel (egg, spinach, salmon, cream cheese, capers, onion on The Works bagel) with outrageous french fries.  We ordered watermelon strawberry juice - squeezed fresh. Pancakes that melted in your mouth. Benedict that sat ontop of a hunk of perfectly cooked thick and juicy steak.   Service is attentive, engaged, courteous and funny as the waiters wear their favorite pajamas taking and delivering one's orders.  The seating is comfortable and the decor is light and happy feeling.  Shirts and other merchandise that will bring a smile to your face is available for sale as well.   Rise & Shine has become one of our "go-to" breakfast and brunch restaurants.   It is hidden away in a small "strip mall" area, but well worth discovering.  We commend Rise & Shine to you - you won't be disappointed.

xZaE3kaJJPcsCPcuDmhQ1Q.text: The chicken fried NY steak and eggs sounded amazing. Not as great as it sounded. Overall, meal was ok. Not worth the 18 bucks I paid for it. Sadly I've had better chicken fried steak for far less. The quality of the steak did not shine like I assumed it would. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the hash browns were well seasoned, but not enough to make it 4 stars.

H30VbVzAZhPCJMNGSvlA1A.text: Absolutely nothing for people lactose intolerant or non meat eaters. Super unhelpful staff trying to find something, anything on the menu to eat. Super expensive to get a 1/8 cup of strawberries for 2.50. Overall terrible experience.

Their hashbrowns are delicious and the bacon is always cooked to perfection. Maria is our favorite server and she always greets us with a warm friendly smile.

jEYnPE1aVseXg0KtvF32Zg.text: Amazing food!! The eggs Benedict with balsamic hollandaise sauce is the best!! Best Loco Moco we have had in town.  Our server Laura was Top notch and always on top of what we needed.  5 stars!

x0o_BuKMDgb6lyyyhMZcKQ.text: First time I've been disappointed in Rise and Shine.  I usually go with the steak and eggs, with the pot of bread.   Today I went with the corned beef hash and eggs.  It's not even corned beef.  It was bacon hash and not a single piece of corned beef.  It was ok but definitely not what I expected.    Eggs ordered over medium.  Came out over hard. And the toast?   It was ok, but I will never understand sending toast out with hard butter on the side.   We asked for them to soften it, however the toast wasn't hot enough to melt it.  Seriously?   I will stick with Mary's Hash House for my hash.  And no, not the over rated Hash House a Go Go.

e3JADF5vfmyr1R1mbke0eA.text: It's good, not the greatest, but good. I wish they would do a traditional country fried steak instead of the fried NY steak that they do. The last time I went I ordered the ham steak and eggs, the ham was great, not over salty and very tasty! I asked for sunny side up eggs, when I received my plate they were sunny side up but basically cooked all the way thru with hard yolks. The breakfast gravy here is better than most places in town and the cup o bread is amazing!

MnuNkarK49VaDplOFikbHA.text: I'm going to start out by saying that I've been to the Southern Highlands location probably a dozen times, and love it.  Yesterday my friend and I were out in Henderson, and decided to stop  because he had been to this one before, and enjoyed the loco moco that they don't serve at the SH location.  I ordered an egg white omelet with chicken sausage, mushrooms and onions, and he ordered the loco moco. I received my "cup o' bread" rather quickly, and just like SH, it was fantastic, and thank goodness because that's pretty much when I stopped eating.   Our food arrived, and I went to put some Tabasco sauce on my eggs. Big mistake! You know how you do things out of force of habit? Well, I foolishly turned the bottle upside down, only to find out the hard way that they had removed the stopper that regulates the pour, resulting in about 3 tablespoons of hot sauce dumped on my omelet. I started to soak it up with napkins, both on top of the omelet, and underneath. figured it would be fine now, so preceded to eat. After a few bites, I lost my appetite. Even after using napkins, there was an absurd amount of butter at the bottom of the plate, and in the omelet itself. I love butter just as much as the next person, but this was a disgusting amount. The other part that disturbs me is that generally when an order for just egg whites is placed, the kitchen usually knows that the person is trying to go the healthier route and doesn't want their food soaked in half a stick of butter (heck, they even have a healthier section on their menu with egg whites listed as the primary options). I finally ended up just picking out some mushrooms and sausage, and quit.  My friend was struggling with his meal too. He asked me if something was wrong, and I told him it was just soaked in butter, he said his was as well, and that he was getting a little nauseous from it.  Our waiter came by about 30 seconds after we first received our food and said, "I know it just got here but is everything ok?" we foolishly said yes prior to even trying anything. When he returned about 10 minutes later, he didn't even ask if something was wrong considering our food hadn't been touched, he just refilled my friend's drink, and we asked for the check. For a regular brewed coffee, a soda, egg white omelet and loco moco, we ended up with a $35 bill (without tip). We left our 90% uneaten food on the table, paid up front and left.   Needless to say, I will stick with the SH location from here on out, but honestly, I'm so mad that I wasted $41 including the tip for a meal I didn't even eat, that I might not be going back to that one for a long time either.

f2RqJ5on0agWPKQ3qKXi0w.text: Was in the smiths parking lot and saw the simple stand sign for some steaks and eggs and thought I would give it a try. Well let's just say I wasn't disaapinted.   First thing i noticed was the cool apparel they were selling which was comical. The waiting staff was dressed in their PJ's,  which I think is great. The place was very clean and the staff was friendly.   Now I went to a steak and egg place so I had to try their specialty which is their ribeye steak and eggs. I have to tell you it was really good, I got my steak medium rare and it tasted amazing. Then you couple it with eggs and hashbrowns, you just can't go wrong. Their Hash browns were very good and different bc they don't season them like a typical breakfast joint does and you can tell they are made with care.   The other interesting food item that came with my meal that they are known for is their "cup o bread." It's like a mini cinabun with a cream syrup that's like a sweet and salty combo that is amazing, it's a must item.   Their omelets are amazing as well, from the ones they have on the menu to your own custom creation. All in all the menu is great bc they have a little bit of everything that they make very well.   Oh yeah and when you go ask to sit in MARIA'S section, she is extremely nice and very friendly.

PW0K3War_2O_cw-LhVMH3g.text: As a new addition to our Sunday tradition, we were not disappointed. I'm sorry I don't recall our server's name- Tom, maybe? Super nice and attentive, dressed in the pj uniform, it was not offensive or reflective. He wore large black frame glasses and those big ear lobe rings.  I was impressed how he knew the menu and options so well by heart, and took our order without writing it down. I admit, that always make me nervous, only because I know I could never do it.  He nailed it! He also offered his personal experience with the rib eye end result. I asked for medium rare. He suggested I cut into it to ensure it was to my liking. I took his clue. It was indeed raw inside. He most happily returned and apologized. When he returned, it was perfect.  For me, the plate was enough for 3+ meals. After leftovers, I diced the ribeye up for a pot of chili. Although popular and busy, we were seated immediately and the pace was perfect. We never felt rushed to turn the table.  The coffee, Lavazza, is delicious. The restrooms are clean. The decor is welcoming and warm. This is now on the repeat list.

brtd0SHTSaszYrLi-rsLDw.text: It was my fiance & I's first time to rise & shine. Maria was our sever and she was phenomenal! The food was to die for and the service was exceptional. We will definitely be back and 110% recommend to anyone and everyone.

3ID9CQPenRdZaB9_zFjpww.text: I really came into this restaurant with an open mind. Considering the name of the place (steak and eggs) and being mostly vegetarian/vegan - I already had my doubts...   However, I gave it a chance because they had promising menu items that just sounded perfect for a late Tuesday morning.   I'd say Rise N' Shine is average and places itself along side known restaurants like Cracked Egg, IHOP, Original Pancake House or Egg Works in good options. For the price, the plate size accommodates well.   That being said, value isn't always in the enormous helpings because it should still look and taste great. Rise N Shine fell short here due to the poorly seasoned and lack of flavors, random arrangements of portions on the plate, as well as how underwhelmed you'll feel at nearly $15.00 average per person pricing.    Let me elaborate...   The poached eggs for the Benedict was very under cooked which is very unappealing. The red onions were stacked and kept in a ring formation giving you overwhelming bites of red onion which completely takes away from the harmonious flavors of hollandaise, capers and lox. :(   The oatmeal is served in a deep large white ramekin which to the average adult may be great, because it keeps the bottom lava hot - but for us parents - this is a disaster as you'll spend several minutes cooling off every bite for even the most advanced toddlers.   The french press in all of its glory was very basic in flavor and could use a better selection of roast to complete the experience.   Overall this place is so-so for kids and really comes across as your sub-par Saturday or Sunday morning and lunch place - which I'm sure has astronomical wait times, as they usually do. Oh and the wait staff is definitely new and needs some practice with sense of urgency and ability to recall orders and average requests from one table to the next.   Largest negative takeaways from that $$ classification will be the lack of parking in this ALWAYS busy location as well as price over value over satisfaction ratio that just isn't hitting high numbers right now.   For the heavy meat eaters or 1200+ calorie seekers, might be most suitable. But for those consciously healthy folks, or parents with large families, you'll find challenges. Solid 3 at best.

_bcjO2lmu8h22n_0zLdGJg.text: Looking for a place to have breakfast after checking out of our VRBO and before dropping BIL off at airport. We originally thought about just grabbing a quick breakfast at the neighboring Starbucks when we spotted this place. Had time enough for a sit down breakfast, but had our pups. Never sure about outdoor patios and if they allow dogs.  After a quick check, we were good to go to their back patio (which only separated from a large Starbucks patio by a gate!) Good thing we had a good amount of time and really were able to just enjoy the patio, weather, and coffee.  While we were seated immediately, the service generally was slow.  But very friendly.  So not sure really how to "rate" this.  Usually I have no patience for this kind of slow service, but it worked for us today as we actually had time to kill. Meals were ok, not superb.  But definitely better than anything you can get at Starbucks. Coffee - Lavazza brand - was good! Mimosa also good I had the carne Asada chiliquilles (sp?)  asked for soft scrambled eggs - got em!!! Yummy! The steak was great! The tortillas in roja sauce was sort of "dry".  maybe a side of the sauce instead of what looked to be store brand salsa, would be better option. Hubs had the chicken fried steak and hash browns,  the steak was huge.  He liked it and made note of how good the gravy was!  Served on side in what I expect is to keep steak crispy.  Good touch. BIL had the egg white omelette.  He ate the entire plate of goodness! His wheat toast came about 10 minutes after the rest of the breakfast and was cold.  So overall, for what we were looking for, good. Not the kind of "write home"experience, but if ever in Henderson again, I'd do breakfast here again

lxcgaGQAkoqxm11cwMZNuQ.text: 4 stars for the egg Benedicts, but everything else we've tried so far hasn't been very good- my mom got an omelet that was dry, I ordered chiquitos which came out as version of an ugly nacho- not edible.... while the hash browns are very good they are just hash browns. The customer service is great but another disappointing thing that happened was we order the ABC breakfast for my 16 Month old baby, instead of meat we wanted a little pinch of fried mushrooms considering a he's a baby and we don't mix dairy and meat together, this was something they wouldn't do unless we wanted to pay extra,.... which we did- but then left me thinking value wise if the mushrooms are more than the meat then what quality of meat are they using here?   Anyway this place is really great in some ways but if the food isn't that good then I don't know if we'll be coming back a third time.

jdH-m6tN1YXfTlo2TnLPrQ.text: We've been to the other locations before and it never ceases to impress or satisfy our hunger. We decided to try the Henderson location this time around.  Definitely was not disappointed. If you're familiar with the other locations, it's the same menu besides the specialty drinks. Started off with the cup o bread. One of my personal favorites. With a hint of cinnamon it's definitely reminiscent of a homemade cinnamon roll with a sweet and slightly tart and tangy icing that goes perfectly with it. Also started off with a single biscuit. This is where it goes from five stars to four. Biscuit seemed a little W. Not as crisp and as flaky as I remember it from the other locations.  I want to hadn't had the biscuits and gravy with two eggs and hash brown. Grady is very rich, chunks of sausage and I believe him add a decadent taste to the silkiness. I couldn't tell if these biscuits were not as flaky as the one I had previous because it was drowned in the savory gravy. Two eggs over medium cooked perfectly and hashbrowns golden perfection and of course the green onions inside the hashbrowns always add the extra kick. Gave this is Danny five out of five. I added the side of bacon to give it a little bit more of that salty savory taste.  We also had the chilaquilles and went to head and splurged and got the steak at it with it. Basic chips over beans covered in red sauce and we have the eggs scrambled. The sauce poured over the tortilla chips is a simple red sauce, very reminiscent of an enchilada sauce. The beans at the bottom were a bit overcooked and dry. The steak was cooked medium as requested and had a very simplistic salt and pepper taste to it which we love.  Had the French press coffee for a stronger coffee taste. 5.95 for a press that served about a cup and a half each for 2 people.  This location is a tad bit small so you tend to hear everything that goes on. There was a Chef or a cook in the open area where the runners and servers go to pick up the food who we could hear on the phone. Not very professional especially when you're using profanity. But other than that Maria, our server was top notch and make sure we were plenty well taken care of.

WCAbRLVjzJK676TZBczskg.text: This place is really good... fresh, tasty food.  The bread in a cup was a tasty, unexpected treat.  It wasn't really that busy when we went in for Saturday morning breakfast but despite that,  service seemed a little slow.   The food itself is good... hearty portions. The coffee... not so much so we sent it back. Pricing is reasonable... the place is clean and relaxing. The wait staff was cordial but not overly welcoming. Overall, a good breakfast place with lots of good options on the menu. We'll probably visit again.

vSXVF2_U2x-1nRW9KnagYA.text: I have a feeling I'll become a regular since I can walk here for breakfast.  Located on the corner of Paseo & Valley Verde, it's convenient and easy to find.    Like their other locations, the cute decor is complete with open umbrellas on the ceiling and wait staff in their jammies.  It's fun and creates a comfortable setting for dining patrons.    Now since it's still fairly new to the area, weekends can get very busy.  But if you have time during the week, you can get a seat immediately.  The hostess staff have all been very quick to greet and get you seated.  The wait staff have also been the same.  The servers I've had have been friendly and attentive.    When I find something I enjoy, I stick with it.  That's why I've had the 3 Little Pigs Bagel a few times. It's definitely a large breakfast sandwich piled with bacon, ham, banger, egg and cheese.  Some of the meats have a distinct smokey flavor that soars.  When you put this on their 'Everything' bagel, it's a complete package.  I've split this sandwich with someone and still walked away full.  Shoestring fries accompany the bagel but you can always get hash browns if you prefer.    I'm happy to have such a close breakfast place.  See you again soon!

xt8VrN_imtTw2VLVrhpA6Q.text: Complete disappointment. I ordered a salad and from the beginning it looked off, but being in a rush and starving I ate it and asked questions later. My mistake. I was right and the salad was missing ingredients. The waitress was going to bring it on the side but the cook said he put it in my salad already. Thankfully the waitress clearly saw it was missing, but I still felt like I was being accused of lying. They were in fact out of the ingredients needed to complete my salad. I got a whopping two dollars off my $15 salad since I stated I did not want "cow bucks" for my next visit. This could have all been avoided if I was informed the ingredients were out from the beginning and I could have ordered something else. The other food was also overpriced and none of it was tasty. Overall a bad experience. Unfortunate for me since I live down the road and love a good breakfast place, but I will not be back.

t5qZ_-IN95KcCXoxONRuaQ.text: Early morning breakfasts spot with great food and you can wear your pajamas to the restaurant?!??!  Yes, here at Rise and Shine you can wear your pajamas and have delicious food.  I stopped into rise and shine while completing  an early pick up and and this place is absolutely amazing. During my visit I ordered the parfait which was really good, I had the clover honey, strawberry and granola parfait.   It comes in a milkshake size glass with the granola on the bottom of the glass, then the next layer is fruit and then the next layer is the vanilla yogurt with the clover honey on top of the yogurt.      I also ordered the chicken and waffle.  The waffle came out hot, fresh and flakey.   You could cut the waffle with a fork.  The chicken (one breast) that came with the waffle had a little kick of heat to it.  The chicken was cooked chicken fried steak style, because it did not have the bone in.  Overall, this is a great brunch spot.

krHpLqYGaLFulRqzcOcFcQ.text: We had a great experience at Rise & Shine on Flamingo - see review here: yelp.com/biz/rise-and-sh.... But this review is for the Rise & Shine location at Valle Verde in Green Valley. I visited here because this location is closer to where I live. I assumed it would be about the same experience as I had at the Flamingo location, but I was wrong. We (my husband, son, and I) entered at 7:50 am on a Friday morning. It had been open for twenty minutes already, so it's not as though they were scrambling to set up. We waited by the door for a couple of minutes and saw no host, or anyone who worked at the restaurant, to seat us. We saw people dining so we knew we weren't the first customers. My husband opened the door again to set the chime off. After another couple of minutes of no one coming to seat us he set it off again. I don't like waiting to be acknowledged in a business. Maybe this is a personal hang-up, but I worked hard for the money I'm about to hand over to someone for a service and if I'm not at the VERY least given a prompt "Good morning, we'll be right with you", I usually leave. There are plenty of other restaurants that are ready for me. Just as we were about to leave, a server came from the back area. No good morning. It's so simple to say "good morning, sorry for the wait". She asked if we were three and seated us. She took our drink order. My husband asked if their water in the restaurant was filtered. He usually thinks water tastes funny if it's not filtered, so he always asks. He doesn't want to waste a full glass of water he won't drink. She took offense to the question. She informed us where she came from, people just turned on the tap and drank whatever came out. I get that she may have been annoyed by the question, possibly it sounded snotty to her, HOWEVER, she could have just said, "I'll go check" and once in the back did a major eye-roll and told everyone back there what a difficult table she had...which she didn't. I think it's perfectly fine to have questions about what we're about to be served, including the water. My husband ordered a bottled water since she didn't know if their watered was filtered or not. When the server came back with our drinks, she said, "Just so you know, the water IS filtered." I'm glad she at least found out, but she said it was such attitude that we felt extremely unwelcome. My husband sat facing the kitchen area and he noticed that all the servers disappeared into the back together, leaving the restaurant unattended for long periods of time, only coming out (eventually) when the door chimed. When they did come out (all together) they seemed to be laughing and goofing off. It was like every customer in the restaurant was an inconvenience to whatever little party was going on back there. Very unprofessional. Have fun and laugh in the restaurant with the patrons. They'll appreciate the good vibes. I ordered the carne asada burrito, which was delicious, my husband ordered three eggs, hash browns and toast and my son got the ribeye again, same as the other location. He thought it was a little overdone, but enjoyed it. So the food was good, but we won't come back to this location. Our server was rude and couldn't even get up the gumption to say good morning in a breakfast place. It was an off-putting atmosphere. Just a suggestion to the management, make sure your employees are more the "Morning Person" type.

SELDSWjJA8KqN9rhg-MlCA.text: We've been to the Southern Highland Rise & Shine and loves the open atmosphere. The food is great so when we found out there was one open in Henderson, we had to come and try.  This one is smaller, a little bit more closed in, and has been just open for a month. Service was good, but not fabulous. Just seem like you have to constantly ask for things like water, napkins, straws, and etc. I ordered a cappuccino and I got whip and caramel on top thinking it comes with it. However, I found out they charge 95cents extra. Everything is ala carte here. Food was yummy except for one dish. The Loco Moco. They served it with day old rice and hard rice from the bottom of the pot. Ground beef was burnt. The waitress took it back and they brought it back with the same rice with a different patty with no eggs. By the time we got it back, everyone was done with their meal and nothing was solved. I could have chipped a tooth with the rice it came with. Waitress was apologetic and took off the check. The thing is, one person went out still hungry with an overpriced check.  Therefore, I don't think I will go back to this one because it was the manager that still approved for the meal to go out the same way the second time. Horrible. This is my reason I gave this place three stars. Or if you still go, don't get the Loco Moco!

Z-Nzo48QOAH9zQCb2vdilA.text: We typically don't like to go off of our beaten path for our food. But husband had an insane craving for steak and eggs. He googled, "Best steak and eggs in Henderson" and he came across Rise and Shine. Let's just say HOT DAMN! The ribeye and eggs were delectable. The ribeye is rubbed in coffee grounds and it was sooo juicy and flavorful. I had the Lox and Cream cheese omelet. I never thought I would enjoy capers in my eggs but wow! This location is the first that serves alcohol and I had the pleasure of trying their sake Bloody Mary. It was light and full of flavor.  Our server, Dane, was informative and super friendly. He kept up on all of our needs and made us feel comfortable.  We will definitely be coming back. Maybe even tomorrow. :)

mihbJwZyMqK4mddVQ96l0A.text: We happened to browse the reviews today and saw one by Maria C stating her dissatisfaction with her visit a couple of weeks ago. Since we are the people referred to in this review (the people who decided to leave), we feel we need to set the record straight. Maria C at least admits that her child was having a meltdown. Beyond that, however, her description is totally inaccurate. She did absolutely nothing to control her child's tantrum. The tantrum was quite extreme & went on and on and on, shrieking screaming and all, and everyone in the restaurant appeared very greatly annoyed. My wife and I couldn't carry on a conversation; indeed, we couldn't even hear each other. We watched other customers go over to their table to ask the mother if she would consider taking the child outside. The mother displayed a cavalier attitude and sarcastically told those customers to "have a nice day." It would have been impossible for us to stay and have breakfast and so we advised the staff that we needed to leave. One of the staff came out to the parking lot right after we left and told us that this party was leaving. So we came back in and had (a wonderful) breakfast.  We take the time to set the record straight as we find it appalling that Maria C would blame anyone in the restaurant for her own failure to supervise her child. Her deliberate indifference to everyone else in the restaurant that day was unjustified. She made no apologies, showed no concern, and instead acted as if it were she who should be aggrieved. She took no responsibility for herself , her child, or the chaos being created. And now to see that she wrote a negative review on Yelp  and totally distorted what happened that day is nothing less than shocking.
